Reviews.Title: “I loveeeeed it here”
Reviews.Author: Aminanyc
Reviews.Content: We are from NYC n loved it ...this is a really nice modern hotel ..... The staff was very nice a helpful all of them down to the cleaning lady was nice ..... the check in was easy .... They give you a booklet of things to do while your there a map so you know were things are which was helpful all most everything is close to the hotel and if its not its 2 are 3 stops on the train.the most....my room was really nice it was 3 of was my 1 friend payed a guest fee cause she didn't book with us but the put in a bed for her....we stayed 7 days n not 1 thing was bad they helped Us look for clubs even called some of them for me 1 night hotel foodwas good ...I would stay in this hotel and tell others to also .......we had a blast in Italy Rome in the u n a .... Stay here ...

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Venus P
Reviews.Content: Completely baffled by other reviews,the staff here have been the rudest most unhelpful that I have encountered in 9 countries. They charge 3 euros for empty wine glasses to take to YOUR room! Are not interested in helping their guests or in their comfort. Rotten experience

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Gina M
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, excellent service and excellent location. We spent a week at Una Hotel Roma and it was a perfect selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great moden hotel-Big rooms”
Reviews.Author: adonosch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good find! It was clean, modern and fresh. We had a large room with a large balcony-the front desk staff was very polite and helpful. Great location to train station makes for an easy and cheap hotel transfer! NOTE: we did our research and the hotel is literally around the corner from the train station. We didn't mind a five minute walk wheeling our suitcases - no big deal for us but, another couple checking in at the same time were charged 25euros for a taxi ride around the corner and were angry at the front desk staff. This had nothing to do with the hotel staff, these people should have gotten a map to learn where the hotel was. All in all, a great location, great staff, modern design and would recommend if in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, 1 min from the train station, high level of service”
Reviews.Author: Murielz
Reviews.Content: we spent only one night in this very beautiful hotel. It is not a lot but we really appreciate the very high level of furnitures, services. All has been arranged with a perfect taste, like the italian are able to do. I really recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Take room looking at street”
Reviews.Author: onur d
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, bed was comfortable. I would definitely give more than 3 stars, if our room was not looking at interior side. hotel is a rectangular shape, so some rooms are looking inside this rectangular. so there is no light or view for those rooms, and always dark. We didn't have any idea how is the weather just before leaving the room. So you must be sure your room is looking at street. Forum is 20-25 minutes away from hotel, by walking, but tourist info and church of Gesu is on your way. We have visited Gesu for every time passing in front of it. It was fantastic. so walking to center was not a problem. Also even at night, walking to hotel is so safe. But this hotel is just next to the train station. I didn't feel secure when I pass to the other side (north) of the station. but to center was at the south of hotel. so no need to walk around the train station at nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: honestreviewsLeeds
Reviews.Content: Well appointed rooms, very modern - great restaurant. The perfect base to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A little more money but worth it”
Reviews.Author: onebigmark
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quaint little Italian hotel, this is not for you. If you are looking for a very clean, well appointed, modern hotel then this one fits the bill. 2 blocks from the Termini, so very easy to catch a train or the metro to go anywhere in Rome. We stayed for 5 nights and never once took a taxi anywhere. The Metro is so easy to use and so inexpensive that Taxi's were not needed. It looks like they have remodeled very recently, the rooms are beautiful, the bathrooms are huge with great showers. The area around the train station was fine, we never felt like we were in a "bad area" and we were out and and about very late at night. When you land in Rome, you can hop on the Leonardo express and you are at your hotel in about 35 minutes. It cost about $190 USD per night for us.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Darren8472
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a long weekend staying at the Una Hotel Roma - What a fantastic place to stay. Staff were so friendly, helpful and knowledgable. We were made instantly comfortable as soon as we walked in the door. The room was extremely clean and comfortable and the bathroom was fantastic as was the stand of decor throughout the hotel. Great location - Close to the station (3 mins) - 20 mins walk to all the main places such as the colosseum, Trevi Fountain etc. Fantastic hotel , fantastic staff and fantastic welcome - thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: ladyinredk
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely experience at Una Hotel Roma. Although the hotel is expensive, it offers 5 stars accommodation. It is placed right next to the Railway station, very convenient for getting a bus to the main attractions of Rome. We even walked to the Column of Traian. It was a nice walk of around 20 minutes. Rooms are well isolated, no funny smell in the bathrooms like in the old hotels of Rome, all new furniture, minibar, and lights in the closet. Good bed and shower. We paid for a normal room, but we received really big rooms, with balconies. We had lots of toiletries, and it was really relaxing at the end of a full day in Rome to come back to this nice hotel. Didn't like the ladies at breakfast's entrance. They were very rude to us, and kept on talking in Italian to us, although we told them that we do not understand, and to speak in English. Breakfast saloon is small and crowded. Not to much choice of food either, but really good coffee. Overall, we would come back to this hotel, if we were to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Tripadvisor, this is a Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Petitewave
Reviews.Content: The reason we chose this hotel is due to the reviews of Tripadvisor travelers. That’s also why I’d like to add on our feedbacks for other travelers. Una is a great hotel. It conveniently located just one block away from the main Rome train station which is very handy to go to major tourist sites in Rome, such as Colosseum and Vatican City, etc. The hotel is very modern, and very quiet despite being so close to the railway station. The room we were in was very comfortable and very clean with adequate storage space. The bed was very comfortable. I particularly liked their super sized bathroom, amenities are adequately provided and nicely presented. The only odd thing is the shower screen was half size (it seems quite common in Italy), so you need to be a bit careful when taking showers to avoid water splashing out. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They directed us how to get to different sites and advised us where the best restaurants were around the hotel. One of their suggested restaurant Ristorante Alessio we liked so much, we ate there 3 times. Overall, it’s a fantastic hotel, good value for money, we will definitely come back when we in Rome next time, and we would be very happy to recommend it to other travellers For Australian and Asian travelers: There are no tea or coffee facilities in hotel rooms , and this seems common practice in Italian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BeefyClare
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room via a well known web site and when we checked in we were told booking had been cancelled! Thankfully they had a room for our stay but not at the price we agreed wigh booking site. The hotel is very clean, new & right across from Rome's main bus/ train station. The standard double us very compact but not small. The furnishings are gorgeous & bed is huge. The room was immaculate. It's a pity there wasn't tea/coffee making facilities in the room but not to worry. Ensuite was very nice & the shower in particular was excellent. Good selection at breakfast but coffee was not great. Drinks at bar, WiFi , and restaurant were very expensive. We didn't eat at the restaurant but comments were good from other guests. Service and staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice to be back”
Reviews.Author: bluegiraffetv
Reviews.Content: This iis the second time staying in this hotel for business. The room rates were reasonable considering the hotel,I got a room upgrade for a nominal fee and did not pay for wifi. I am writing the review on the wifi right now:-) Very happy here, you know what to expect. Looking around I see a lot of places for not much less that I suspect might be a big dissapointment. I walked all over the place and found it central and well connected to the Leonardo service from the airport and the Metro. Staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Train Station- Superior Rooms Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: FlagstaffAZ1
Reviews.Content: Just one block from the main Rome train station. Across the street is Viator's tour company main office. The rooms were the largest and most modern on our stay in Italy. We did do the upgrade to the superior room which was worth it. Nice comfortable King size bed and huge bathrooms, lots of closet space. Walk in shower. Made a great home base. Plus they had a nice computer center in the lobby. From their we took the train to the Colosseum and Vatican City. Would highly recommend this hotel. Especially for first time Rome visitors like us with a 6 yr old. Around the corner was an excellent Italian restaurant Ristorante Del Secchio. Best calamari. Plus for a fast breakfast there was a McDonald next to the train station to pick up before going on the tours.

Reviews.Title: “Not all bad but prob not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Crepes2
Reviews.Content: The room was nice but quite compact. It is v close to termini but there is not much in the way of decent restaurants nearby. The hot buffet breakfast was inedible and the cost of the wifi and bar extortionate. There is v limited room service and the reception from staff fairly frosty. You could prob get more for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Italia”
Reviews.Author: vitalvixen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Very clean and modern and also a decent size. The bathrooms were gorgeous and the the bed was super comfortable as well. The hotel is 1 block away from the train station but was on a side street so it was quiet and you did not get the noise from the traffic and people from train station. Wifi is a bit pricey and you can only hook 1 computer to it at a time. The staff were friendly...although not as welcoming as most hotels i have stayed at but that could have been because of the language barrier. Overall a good stay. http://www.vitalvixen.com/blog/?p=186

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kripu
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is new, so every things is very clean and modern. The rooms are very confortables and spacious, very nice furnishing in the room and in the bathroom. You should ask for the rooms in the upper level, but anyway the hotel, closer to the railways station, is in a lateral and quiet street. The breakfast is very good and rich.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but wifi was crazy expensive”
Reviews.Author: dmf_singapore
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel and the helpfulness of the staff were all huge positives. But 6 Euro for an hour for the use of wifi left a bad taste in my mouth, and because of that, I'm not sure I'd choose to stay there again. There is really no excuse for such a high wifi cost. We stayed on the 6th floor and twice when coming home there was a strong sewage smell in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: LanarkshireTraveller
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay in the Una and have given it a good review in the past but was not so happy this time. We payed extra for a superior room with a terrace as it was our wedding in Rome and on arrival we were extremely disappointed with the size of the room (the smallest one we have ever had in the Una and smaller than our friends who were all in normal rooms). We needed extra room for the bride to get ready but on speaking to reception they were not willing to help us. On day 2 I noticed that all the rooms next to us were at least double the size and we were finally moved into another which gave us much more room. I'm not one to complain but I felt thet they didn't go out of their way to help us even though we needed assistance with our wedding. The hotel is still nice but some family members commented on the staff not being friendly or helpful therefore I do not think I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “rome”
Reviews.Author: grosminet42
Reviews.Content: very well situated , 2 minutes by walk to Rome Termini train station, very nice staff ,nice room,good breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for short stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug47648
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Room was a decent size, huge power shower and comfortable beds. Our room overlooked tram line but did not excessively disturb sleep. Beds were extremely comfortable. Breakfast buffet was high quality and varied, service was good. Literally 3 minutes walk from Roma termini train station. More than met our needs for one night in Rome before catching train to Florence. Would stay here for up to 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient”
Reviews.Author: bros43
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a block from the main railway station in Rome so within easy walking distance with luggage. It is also very close to the main Hop on Hop Off bus stop and is surrounded by many typical pavement restaurants. The staff were obliging and helpful. We were able to leave our suitcases there while we took a 5 day trip to Sorrento. On return we were upgraded to a suite which was very nice! The breakfasts which were included were excellent, but I think the the restaurant may have been quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “was ok”
Reviews.Author: Bhumiputra
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Clean, good breakfast. good location, next to Termini, shops and sites. Stayed on the 6th floor executive room with terrace. Although the general opinion about this hotel is very good there were some things deserving your attention. When checking in we were given probably the worth room on the 6th floor – very far from the elevator, TINY, right under the hotels conditioners on the roof and almost in front of the other building undergoing roof renovation( for Eur 200 a night). There was also some bad odor in the corridor in that area of hotel ( sewerage or conditioning). And this happens when 6th floor is practically empty…after asking other room there was not a problem to offer two great rooms right next to the elevator, twice as big as the first one. I still do not get it – why hotels sometimes do this. Although our stay was generally great I still have this feeling of being cheated. Another “amazing” feature of this place is that you can not get wine glass from the bar unless you pay Eur3 for renting one. I could see of how embarrassed were people in restaurant and in the bar to say that. What a joke! And this is hotel claiming 4 stars…Just because these two little but “killing” things I would not return to Una. In any case I encourage you to try your luck because the place is good from many aspects. Another hint – take the bus from the airport – it costs 8 Eur instead of 14Eur train and you get complimentary city tour

Reviews.Title: “Una , great place”
Reviews.Author: Cathie117
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the una hotel in rome in oct 2011 first time in rome, great place ! It is very modern, great breakfast and staff VERY nice, i would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome. Close to train station about 5 mins walk . would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A favorite hotel let me down a bit this time”
Reviews.Author: marcshiman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a couple times that I was passing through Rome. I love the location close to Termini (literally a block away) and I think is a great clean, well built new hotel. The room are ultra modern, the beds a great pleasure. This past stay was largely the same, except for a rather bad end to the visit. My complaints are otherwise very limited. First, the TV's 500 channels could afford to have one or two more English channels than CNN and BBC. They started me in an absolutely tiny room overlooking the block with a tram line, and all night the tram kept me up everytime it passed. The staff graciously found me a much more spacious inner room which was marvelously quiet. Even without having any sort of view, I was quite happy with the change. One complaint I have with this hotel is the bath/shower. There are no handholds, and you have to step WAY up and over the edge of the tub to get into to the rather slick surface to take a shower - still no handholds. They are a very serious accident (plus subsequent lawsuit) away from having new hotel owners, as getting around inside the tub is a very treacherous experience particularly getting out. I found the safest way to do it was slither out like a snake. My real disappointment came from the non-working phone system through which they were supposed to have given me a wakeup call. No ringing phone, I slept happily two hours longer than I wanted resulting in a 50 euro cab ride to the airport rather than a much cheaper train ride. When I asked the manager to help with the cab fare, she shrugged and said "no, we can't do that". Very disappointing. Would I stay there again? Probably. Although I certainly won't rely on them for a wakeup call.

Reviews.Title: “The Ideal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rita c
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the UNA last September. Our first impression was that the Hotel was situated in an excellent location. The interior design is modern and beyond reproach. The bedrooms are very clean, spacious and comfortable. We dined at the Una Ristorante and were impressed by the friendly service provided by the two young waitresses Fabiana and Giada. Their positive and helpful attitude contributed to a wonderful evening. The food and the wine were up to the best Italian traditions and standards. Well done and keep it up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel not best location”
Reviews.Author: vegas12330
Reviews.Content: The una hotel is brilliant. Check in was fast n we were met with very pleasant staff. We were in 502 and 504. The rooms were immaculate and had everything we needed. The breakfast was great everything you could want and again the service was superb and the breakfast room was immaculate. Overall we were very pleased with our hotel and staff, however there is a big down side it's in a very bad area. We saw a prostitute on the corner of the street The hotel is on, not once but two nights. It is a stones throw from the termini station and it is surrounded by weirdos and dead beats from 7pm it is not an area we felt comfortable or safe in. Its also about a 20 min walk from the Trevi fountain. It's a shame because it's overall a good hotel once your in it

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, comfortable, well located”
Reviews.Author: sferaverde
Reviews.Content: Una Hotel Roma is located minutes from the Central Station (Termini Roma), where you arrive by the Leonardo express train from Fiumicino Airport, or by any other means of public transportation for that matter. It's a few steps away from the corner of Via Cavour which will take you all the way down to the Colosseo (doable on foot). The hotel is decorated in a contemporary style that's both classic elegance and modern convenience. We stayed on the 6th floor and had superior rooms with terraces, which would've been put to greater use had it not been November.The rooms are good size, nicely furnished in warm tones of cream, beige and soft browns. Breakfast (included in the price) was a bonus. It offered pretty good selection of cold cuts, cheeses, eggs, fresh fruit, pastry, dairy, etc. The service at breakfast was fantastic when Bernadetta was on duty. The day she was off, things deteriorated quickly. The dishes kept mounting on our table, with noone paying attention. One thing, I did not like was lack of free WiFi (it was available at 6 EUR/hr) which one tends to excpect at this sort of a hotel nowadays. Other than that, UNA Hotel turned out to be a super choice for our short stay in Rome. I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best chic hotels in rome!”
Reviews.Author: fergiesboys81
Reviews.Content: Recently back from a trip to the eternal city. Lovely architecture fantastic customer service and stunning rooms with high finish. Upgraded on arrival as it was my 30th. I Also went to Lake Como where i proposed to my gf on a private speedboat which I drove in the middle of lake como!! Easy to get there via Milan as near main términi station. Make sure you go for a higher floor to avoid metro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nicely upgraded”
Reviews.Author: CSkuza
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and 2 days. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. Nice size for European hotel. Centrally located by Termini station. Breakfast was included. Internet is available at a fee. We were able to check in early the first day, they were very accomodating. We chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor and we were very happy with our choice. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Ama_Israel
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Clean and modern rooms. Good location near Termini train station. Helpfull staff. Breakfast was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Near Halal Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Cakes71
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in the hotel. Got a free upgrade to a superior room with terrace- unfortunately it was too cold to go out! Room and toilet were adequate but no kettle. Staff busniess-like in their interactions. Do note that they strictly enforce check-out at 12noon- they will disable the room key cards at precisely that time! So inform early if you want a later check-out. The best thing about the hotel is there are about 5 halal eateries in the immediate surrounding area. I would advise to pack the food to go though, cos like in many countries, areas near the main train stations tend to be pretty dodgy especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs! Better sleep in the street!”
Reviews.Author: Klidimos
Reviews.Content: Lets start by the area; dodgy and dangerous to say the least. After three days my wife and I were lucky to be alive. Crooks and thugs in every inch around the hotel and Termini station after 20:00. Average (even though clean; I give them that) reception and staff that gave the impression that couldn't care less about the customer or about anything that was going on around them. The welcome was pretty average but the first impressions from the room were very good: god size, very clean, wooden floor, immaculate bathroom but the room was SOOOO COLD that not even a polar bear could sleep there. The aircon was fixed at 21 degrees in November! Yes, in November..I am not joking. We of course complained only for the non-caring staff to say that this is a good temperature and we shouldn't feel cold. From when is the staff's job to judge whether a customer rightly feels cold or hot or whatever? Their job is to help resolving problems and nothing else. It is obvious that management absolutely forgot to train their staff; needless to say that management was non-existent even when I asked to speak to them. I was told off (!) by the receptionist as unreasonable! These things are beyond this world and shouldn't even be happening to 2* hotels. I wonder how they got their 4* rating and thsi will remain a mystery to me! I noticed that the hotel had security at the entrance; why??? Nobody would ever go in. Why go sleep in the hotel when its nicer and warmer outside even in November month????? Am I the unreasonable here???? Seriously if you have respect for yourself find somewhere else to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good position and a resonable hotel but extras were expensive”
Reviews.Author: Don S
Reviews.Content: Overall I have to say this hotel was comfortable and clean. The breakfast was simple but excellent in terms of choice and quality of produce. Room service was expensive and a little bland. As a guide you can walk to most of the major historical attractions in under 20 - 30 minutes. The metro is very close (2 minutes) and this will get you to the Vatican in under 10 minutes...(The Vatican being the furthest historical site away from this hotel). The internet access was very expensive but they did offer full day or logon/logoff plans. 60eu for 3 full days or 18eu for 6 hours on demand. The staff were mostly helpful but definitely only did as much as they had too. We lost our bag at the airport (we don't speak Italian) and there was no help contacting the airport for us. We asked reception but really ended up having to do it our selves as we could tell it wasn't something the staff wanted to do or made us feel comfortable that they would handle it well for us. If you're new to Italy, don't expect to get any movie channels on the TV either. Italian hotels just don't seem to think there's a market for it. This hotel is no exception...but then, Rome is too beautiful to be stuck in a hotel room watching movies I quess...unless you're a kid! There's no gym and this part of the city doesn't really lend itself to running routes either, so if you're an exercise freak, probably look elsewhere I think. We did have a good experience when we bought some expensive wine at the hotel. The waiter arranged a small lunch for us which we didn't have to pay for. I nice touch but probably due to the price of the wine. There's no iron or coffee facilities in the room either. There was also no hair conditioner either. The room we had was also very small. Difficult to navigate with 2 bags as the bed took up most of the available space. All in all I think most people would be comfortable at this hotel...but it's unlikely to leave an indelible memory if you know what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Packer_Backer_too
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the UNA Hotel Roma for two nights. We selected this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel is new and modern with lots of glass, chrome, and high tech features. Our room was small, but very efficient with a large bathroom, a good bed and adequate storage space, room safe, etc. The room and all of the public areas were very clean. While it is located on a busy street, the room was very quiet. Breakfast was included in the price. Breakfast is served in a large, attractive dining room and features an attractive bountiful breakfast buffet with a good selection of hot and cold items. The quality of the food was only marginal. One of the advantages for us was the helpful front desk staff who were always willing to make recommendations, dinner reservations, provide maps, etc. The hotel is located only a short block from Termini station which is Rome's main train station and also a hub for all local public transportation. It has a large variety of shops, atm, and other tourist services. We read several comments about the area around Termini being unsafe, but we never felt uncomfortable there. The area is home to a large number of immigrants from India, North Africa, and a mix of others. The area is not a slum, but not very attractive. We walked to some very good local restaurants at night and never had a problem on the busy streets. Compared with other Rome hotels we considered, I think the UNA Hotel Roma is an excellent choice. If it was located in a more attractive neighborhood, it would be a superior hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean but no free internet”
Reviews.Author: Tumerg
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 nights in Una Hotel Rome this week. We were overall satisfied. The room was a small, but clean and comfortable. The only problem was the noise of the tram which was passing by the Hotel every 10-20 minutes, but it was not that bad.. The breakfast was excellent, the staff kind and helpful. What I did not like at all was the lack of free internet, still many hotels are requesting payment, and Una Rome is one of them. The next time I will choose another hotel with free internet access, for me it is as important as breakfast included. T.Gurkok

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Room I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Jnorth1985
Reviews.Content: Una Hotel in Rome is fantastically located and a stylish, quality, contemporary hotel. We were (for some reason) upgraded to a suite and I can honestly say it is the best room I have ever stayed in. Room: Suite had a living room with desk and sofa, sliding doors to a seperate bedroom with a massive solid walnut bed with controls for all the room functions on the bedside tables. Bathroom had a huge showerhead and bath and so many items included - shower gel, shampoo conditioner, hand cream, body lotion, manicure set, shaving set, batch salts, scented candle, tootbrushes and tootpast, robles, slippers etc...There was also an illuminating wardrobe and safe. For me, having lovely tea and coffee facilities was a real bonus abroad. There was Twinings tea bags! Service: Excellent. Very polite, English speaking Reception staff and porters. We checked in at about 4pm, went out for the evening and returned at around 10pm to find that our room had been turned down. Towels were replaced, robes folded and milk replenished. Food The restaurant / breakfast room was a lovely cosy, contemporary room with a good ambience. There was an excellent variety of breakfast items although I would say the quality could have been slightly better. Tea / coffee was brought to the table (although we were forgotten about initially) Location A stones through from Termini Station - the main hub for the train, Metro and Taxis. You can get anywhere easily from here with excellent links to the airport too. Termini is walkable to the main sights (we did) but not completely central. If you want to be really right in the middle of things, opt for a location near the Spanish Step[s or somewhere like that. Metro is brilliant and costs only 1 euro for 75 mins Overall, I would recommend this hotel without hesitation and most definitely return myself

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Classy”
Reviews.Author: David E
Reviews.Content: I am happy to report that UNA Roma Hotel worked out great my travel needs mid-October 2011. My wife and I took the train from FCO to the Termini station and walked about 2 blocks to the hotel. We arrived at about 09:00 and our room was not quite ready, but we were able to check our bags with an attentive young man. The front desk attendants where very responsive and eager to help. I was extremely impressed with the hotel's modern look and feel. Doors, elevators, lighting in rooms, closets, bathrooms and shower - even the thick glass soundproof windows that could open with a built-in sunshade to keep light out if we wanted to sleep in. There was even a speaker for the television in the bathroom with its own volume control. The breakfast buffet was huge and such a great way to start the day. I wish there were better English langauge television stations though.

Reviews.Title: “Super service quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: rene h
Reviews.Content: This quality hotel was a pleasure to stay at , made all the better by the exceptional customer service we recieved from all the staff. I dont think i met a friendlier group of people. well done Una.

Reviews.Title: “A modern Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Michael R
Reviews.Content: The Una Hotel in Rome is very modern, clean and well run. A good location, five minutes walk from Rome's main railway station, 'Termini'. The Colosseum and Forum are only twenty minutes walk from the hotel. The modern rooms are comfortable and well appointed. The buffet breakfasts are very good with a great selection on offer. The staff are helpfull and friendly. The only minor niggle was the electronic control pad in the bedroom. Trying to adjust or being able to turn the air-con and lights on and off didn't seem to be an option. If you are looking for a modern hotel to stay in while visiting Rome the Una would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel ideal for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: antiguababe
Reviews.Content: We booked the Una Hotel because we wanted somewhere central for sightseeing and of a high standard. We arrived at the hotel early expecting to have to wait for a room, but were pleasantly surprised to be told our room was ready and we were being upgraded to an Executive Room on the top floor. The room was spacious and had a lovely bathroom, although it was at the back of the hotel so had no view, but on the plus side it was very quiet, with no noise from the street or other guests. The breakfast was great, with a large selection available from the self-service buffet and there was lovely freshly made coffee which set us up for the day. Being a few minutes from the main Terminus, the hotel was ideal for our sightseeing and also just a 5 minute walk from where the airport shuttle bus drops/picks up, which was good value at 8 euros each. The reception staff were fantastic and helped with any questions on places to visit, location of restaurants etc. and the staff for breakfast cheery and helpful. Our only negative comments would be that they charge for wi-fi and that we were given no warning about the Protest that was to happen on the Saturday, which we had to cross through to get back to the hotel. Lots of roads in central Rome were closed off, so there was no transport if you wanted to get a taxi/bus back to the hotel. Being as it was such a large Protest, I think some kind of warning would have been helpful. We would definitely return to this hotel if we were in Rome again and will try other hotels within the Una Group.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Comfort, Luxury.”
Reviews.Author: CinarK
Reviews.Content: Hotel is so close to termini station and another places for visit. Firstly, this great hotel have a over expected standard rooms for staying. My girlfriend and I stayed 2 nights in this hotel and everything was perfect in a hygienic and comfort way. Breakfast service had a good croissant and cake selections. Our travel purpose based on traveling but I think this place is amazing and satisfy both business and travelers choice.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I chose Una Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfsonoma
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and were very happy with this hotel. Had a room on the sixth floor with a huge terrace, great shower and comfortable bed. Having a back injury I found the one chair in the room very uncomfortable but managed by taking the terrace chair inside and using it. The room was very quite. With the door closed you could not even hear the train running below the terrace. You can tell they invested in excellent soundproofing when they built. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was the wifi. It was the worst we had out of four hotels in Italy. For such a new, modern hotel I found that surprising. Sending simple email took forever and many news sites I read elsewhere would not even load. That being said I would definitely stay here again and would recommend to those who don't really care about internet access. Hopefully they can get that fixed and merit that 5 star rating they deserve.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: billthoo
Reviews.Content: We booked UNA Rome after consulting Tripadvisor reviews and looking at the hotel website. We were looking for a hotel with modern decor, as were are not generally fond of traditional Victorian era hotel looks, or Transylvanian / Dracula movie ambience. UNA fit the bill, and was also incredibly convenient to Romes Termini Station. We prepaid for our stay directly with the hotel through it's website. We came in from Rome airport via the Leonardo Express train, and hence arrived at Termini. We didn't realise that the Leonardo Express platform is in fact about half way along the Rome Termini, so walked a bit further to find the UNA Hotel than expected, but it was not too difficult. Our room was ready on arrival, a blessing after 24 hours (literally) of jet travel. Check in was effecient and the desk staff spoke good English, though desk staff are not necessarily the warmest we've seen. A porter assisted with out luggage, though it was not necessary. He accepted a small tip. The rooms are very small, as descibed by others, but there was enough space to lay out both our full sized luggage. The king bed dominates the space, and is comfortable. If you have read any of the reivews you should really expect this from the start, and the room size was comparable to any in Hong Kong,London, Paris or Tokyo we have stayed in. The bath room is a good size, but there is limited bench space to lay out toileteries. There is a safe, but it was tempremental to work. A small fridge could accept 1 litre bottles. There were no kettle facilities. The room cleaning service requires towels to be placed on the floor to be changed, and paper ticked for sheets to be changed. The room cleaning service didn't change our towels on one occasion, despite being on the bathroom floor, and after changing our sheets on one occasion, did not leave the chit for chagning sheets again. Breakfast is in a bright dining area. Staff are attentive, friendly, and efficient. Coffee was wonderful (you could even have weak, insipid, "Americano", but only if you hated the tast of coffee...!). The breakfast spread was limited (bacon, eggs, sausage, then a mix of cold cut meats, pastries, cereal, fruit), but very edible. The Leonardo Express aside, the hotel is really only 1 block from the main Rome Termini platforms. As were predominantly travelling by rail internally to Italy, this was a major plus. It is about 2 minutes walk to Santa Maria Maggiore church, 20 minutes walk to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and about 1 hour to Saint Peters Basilica. The area feels reasonably safe walking back from those attractions, though the area around Termini Station itself a night has a different, much more edgier feel. The room cleaning issues aside, we enjoyed our stay at UNA Rome, and would consider staying there again. Benefits: Modern room, incredibly close to Termini Station, walking distance to all attractions (but must like to walk), wam breakfast staff. Improvements: Kettle in room, room cleaning service (towel and sheet changes).

Reviews.Title: “Una Beautiful Roma”
Reviews.Author: markarmel
Reviews.Content: WOW!! We loved it here. Out 5 night stay was in luxury - Gorgeous large room with a big comfortable bed and a luxurious bathroom, which was fantastic after a day of sightseeing beautiful Rome. The location of this hotel is excellent only a block from the Termini train station and still close enough to walk to the sights. The staff was very helpful and friendly especially the breakfast and restaurant staff. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant 2 of the nights and found it exceptional and inexpensive. We will definitely return here one day in the future and highly recommend Una Hotel Roma to anyone visiting Rome. Thank you to all there that helped make our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulesTorontoCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days at the Una Hotel and were very pleased with the accomodation and staff. the room was better than we had expected, the complimentary breakfast was fabulous and the front desk staff very helpful. It was a 5 min. walk from the train station and all the sights were within walking distance. We would stay again without hesitation. They made reservations for us at Trattoria Cecio restaurant which was well priced and wonderful, and only a couple blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but room very small”
Reviews.Author: WonderWomann
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located practically bang opposite the Rome Termini station- so basically a great spot from where all tour buses start, taxis are readily available and of course Metro and Eurostar connections. However the area is quite dingy and sleazy with very bad tourist trap restuarants nearby so if you stay here make sure you eat elsewhere and be careful walking back at night. We used to walk back as late as 11.30pm but there was very dodgy crowd on the street but we didn’t face any major problems as it was a crowded area and quite well lit. The Hotel itself is clean and polished with polite front desk staff. They did not have free wi fi but there are cheap internet cafes for this nearby. The room and bathroom are spotlessly clean with soft clean sheets, pillows and towels but the major flaw, and I emphasize this because it does erode all the other pros of this hotel, is the room is so tiny (occupied 95% by the bed) that 2 people cannot move from the bedside to the bathroom! Its so surprising that they did not think of making the bed an inch smaller so that a person can walk properly from the bedside to the bathroom. There is not even space for 2 suitcases, just one and the room is soooo crammed that both people have to sit on top of the bed all the time. Whatever the other benefits of this hotel if you cannot walk from the bedside to the bathroom it really makes you question a second stay there. Having lived and travelled across several countries in Europe I do understand room sizes cant be huge but this was unacceptable for the price you pay to stay here. Other than this, the breakfast was plenty (Italian) and huge with proper cappuccino and polite staff. The front desks gave us a map, recommended a lovely restaurant for dinner and were rarely rude (common in many European hotels). The toilet was nice and clean with standard toiletries. The room however did not have any tea/coffee makers/ingredients. To summarize- Pros- near to Termini, clean, polite staff, good breakfast, soft sheets and towels, toiletries. Cons- slightly sleazy area, room size, leaky bidet that was not fixed during entire stay in spite of repeated requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: JoelRy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Good location and rooms are very modern. Space is a premium and they do a great job with it. The service was top notch, my wife really liked the pillow menu. Liked: - Great ambiance & service - Modern design is top notch - Sleep quality was incredible. We had a courtyard room which was great --seriously, incredible sleep quality for the middle of downtown Things to improve: - Internet access was expensive and didn't work reliably --had to keep signing in; seriously, just make it part of staying at the hotel folks! - Breakfast was good, service was great. As others said, the eggs were a bit weird but fine. Can't improve, but be aware of: - Slim pickings on restaurants in a 2-3 block radius. Walk farther and there are a few more options. - As others said, the neighborhood between the main station and the hotel is a touch sketchy, but I really didn't find it to be an issue. Related: - We did Johnny Madge's Olive Oil Tour on our last day and that was the icing on the cake. http://www.tripadvisor.com/Travel-g187791-d1592525/Rome:Italy:Johnny.Madge.Olive.Oil.Tour.html

Reviews.Title: “trendy rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: brittGlendora_Ca
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel on our first stop on our italian trip modern rooms with high ceiling, modern bedrooms and baths with all the up to date gadgetry at your bedside the hotel was very clean and would stay here again the service was good and the location pretty close to the train terminal mary maggiore church, a must see

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience at Una Roma, I strongly recommend to fellow travelers”
Reviews.Author: KOLBABU
Reviews.Content: We were at Rome for 4 days in September and chose Hotel Una Roma for our stay. I must say we had a very pleasant stay at the hotel. First of all, the location of the hotel is very good, near to the Termini railway station, only a five minute’s walk. Front office staffs were very helpful and smiling. On our enquiry; they have also suggested us about the good restaurants in the Rome and the restaurants were really good. During our stay at the hotel on my wife’s Birthday, I ordered for a flower bouquet and a cake for my wife and the hotel did not charge us for the cake. I was really a nice gesture from the hotel. Breakfast was good with lot of variety on the menu and we started our long day with a full stomach. Only flipside was the size of the room, we were given a room on the first floor and the room was a bit small. In room amenities was upto the mark very neat and clean, sleep quality was great. Overall, it was a nice experience staying at Una Roma; I happily recommend this hotel to fellow traveler for enjoyable stay at Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels fine *plus* Warning”
Reviews.Author: tony c
Reviews.Content: If your happy with efficient friendly reception staff, a comfortable clean room (great shower) and decent breakfast, then you've found your hotel. Yeah, its pricey and you'll need to use public transport but is that not part of the fun. WARNING Please be very careful on the Metro and be on your guard just in general in Rome. I had my pocket picked on the Metro within the blink of an eye and didn't feel a thing (hand out of pocket to grab pole on train, hand back in wallet gone). Just luckily i used the hotel room safe, usually don't cos i don't trust room safes but the ones at the hotel Una seem secure so I only lost some cash.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but a bit on the expensive side when compared to others”
Reviews.Author: Biscas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 1m walk from Stazione Termini so it is very convenient for travelers! In fact, from the front of the rail station, it takes you longer to find and get to your train than to reach the hotel. Service: Probably not the hotel’s strong point since almost everyone from the reception desk to ushers seemed to be waiting for their shift to end. Mind that they were helpful and professional but did not seem to be enjoying their work very much. The room: we stayed in 406, our room faced an interior courtyard so the view was NOT interesting but I must admit that in term of a good night’s sleep, it was great! The room is large and very clean but the hallways do need a bit more carrying for since it looks as if the cleaning staff slam their carts into the walls and corners and that is very visible as you walk through them. Breakfast: Simple! We will find most everything that a typical 4 star hotel will have for breakfast. Unfortunately, we only stayed at UNA Rome for one night and even though the hotel is very conveniently located and clean I have stayed in similar hotels in other large cities for lower prices! You won’t go wrong if you stay at UNA but it does carry a hefty price tag when compared to other similar hotels.

Reviews.Title: “3 C's - Clean, Convenient, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Schmoopie63
Reviews.Content: We chose UNA because it was near (one block from northern end) Termini in Rome. We were a little nervous because we had read that most Termini hotels were seedy or in a dangerous area. UNA is SO new that of the 3 cabs we took, only one had heard of it and none knew where it was. It's BRAND spanking new and beautiful and you cannot beat the price. We complied with a great pre-paid (non refundable) promotion and it made our stay extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tgh05
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and attractive. Reception and all staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast to International standards and evening restaurant quite adequate Our superior room was a Junior Suite and very comfortable. Location was good and the little restaurant on the corner nearby was very good. Easy Termini access is a bonus for Venice bound travellers. We were unfortunately "skinned on the spot" by management who took advantage of our one day out in six to charge us a higher rate for the last two nights ,this in spite of our changing the booking by email several weeks prior.. they had suddenly, mysteriously, "lost" their reservation change reply when we arrived ..caveat emptor

Reviews.Title: “Excellent last night in Rome”
Reviews.Author: eb08tg
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 weeks renting an apartment in Rome ,we decided to stay at a hotel for the last night. Hotel was excellent, friendly service and the room was very clean. It's right by termini station which is very convention for travelers but for sightseeing around the vatican, spanish and pantheon it might be a longer walk than desirable. I have to say, I will never forget the sleep I had the night at this hotel. The bed was so comfortable I did not want to get out in the morning and after two weeks sharing a small bed it was wonderful to finally sleep comfortably again. The staff was also very helpful, we ended up having to arrive 3 hours earlier than our 1pm check in but they stored our luggage away safely for us and checked us in so we could get some lunch and explore the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kytana36
Reviews.Content: We took the train in from Florence and this Hotel was very conveniently located. It was close enough to the train station that it was only a 5 minute walk to the hotel. The hotel is modern and very nice. The room is a on the smaller side, but there is enough space and lighting so we didn't feel cramped. The worse part of the room is the shower. It's basically a 2' x 2' area with a shower curtain around it. The area is a little bit lower than the rest for the water to drain. The problem is that if the curtain isn't just right, you basically flood the entire bathroom! It really is a poorly designed shower, On the bright side, the water pressure is great! The free breakfast in the morning is a really nice way to start the day off in beautiful Roma!

Reviews.Title: “New and clean cut, but lacking some service.”
Reviews.Author: MichelleLG-84
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were pleasantly suprised at home new and clean cut it all looked, recently renovated and done quite well. The room and bed were big but that is where most of the pleasant suprises stopped. The wifi charges were outrageously expensive, we ended up using a local internet cafe. Even though we were out seeing Rome almost all of the day each afternoon when we got back the room was not made up and just as we were settling in for a nap or to relax they would try to come, even with the do not disturb light AND sign reception still called, quite annoying. Breakfast however was fantastic, the buffet was a great spread. We were only on the first level and the room was VERY noisy. Street noise and trams, right outside the window. If you are looking for a peaceful indulgent stay I would not recommend this, however, it is large and close to the centre of the city and therefore if getting around easily is your priority it would be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: didi3958
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean & the rooms are very spacious. Very near to the Roma Termini. The personnel at the front desk are all helpful, in particular Francesca. She was very friendly & a lovely smiling face in a city that smiles infrequently. The only negative is the cost of 25 Euros for a days internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great bed”
Reviews.Author: Auswalkers
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel at the end of our 3 week visit to Italy. Traveling by train from Naples we arrived to walk only about 300 metres to our hotel. The staff greeting was impressively friendly and our room was first class. We did though certainly know when the trams started at 6.00 am in the morning outside our window. The bed was great and probably the best we had in Italy. We dined in the restaurant that night and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the set menu meal as well as the service. The Rome attractions - Colliseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps were all wthin 20 minutes walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: MH_Brasil
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice! Neighbor Termini station and easy access to all major attractions of Rome. Modern, spacious and very comfortable rooms. Spacious and modern bathrooms. Competent staff and helpful. There is an interesting option to include minibar and Internet for 10 Euro daily (with peanuts, potato chips, beer, water, juice and Coca-Cola).

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience. Too many problems.”
Reviews.Author: travel340
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Una Hotel Rome for 4 nights. Our room smelled of mold. We looked in the washroom and the bathtub had black mold everywhere. It was disgusting. We told the front desk and they moved us to another room (which appeared to be better). The second room, although a bit bigger had the worst plumbing problems; toilet, bathtub and sink were all blocked and we told management a few times to no avail. The bed had a dry blood stain in the sheets. Beyond gross. It was finally changed after we pointed it out. The room in general was dusty and not taken care of properly. The maid forgot to leave clean towels twice and to top it all off, there was an ant colony all over the room. We had to keep our luggage closed. They were everywhere and after pointing out all these problems, management finally sent a plumber and they sprayed for the ants. Would definately NOT stay here ever again. It's not the guests' duty to tell the hotel what is wrong with the rooms. We chose it due to the proximity to the station since we were travelling by train and also because it is a "new" property. The food too for breakfast wasn't all that. The same old boring packaged stuff, runny eggs, worst espresso ever. . Being in Rome, I expected more from the food at least. The hotel lobby and the furnishings are modern but the hotel is definately not worth the price it charges. Terrible! Stay away and spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel. It is located near the termini stazione in rome. The service was pleasant, the receptionist was nice. In terms of the rooms and the facilities of the hotel seem great on first sight. When you look clearer, there was mold on the ceiling of the bathroom. They do have wifi, but you have to pay for it. As an 4* hotel, I thought providing free internet was a common... we were a bit disappointed in this case.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: paymoto
Reviews.Content: We were stopping in Rome for the night on our way out of Italy and this was a very convient hotel. It is one block from the Termini train station where you can take the train to get to the airport very easily. It was very nice and modern on the inside and had a fantastic breakfast included. Wi-fi is available for a fee only, there is a business center but that is also on the same fee scale. We found the hotel staff to be polite but not overly helpful. We booked a Superior room and it was quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor but disorganized”
Reviews.Author: TOMM4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the UNA hotel in Rome in August twice for a total of 6 nights. The location is great that it is very close to the rain station. At night some of this area can be a bit daunting though. The hotel decor is very modern - almost the feeling of a boutique hotel. The staff are reasonably friendly the room was a nice very modern room. The downside of our room was that the AC never went below 73 which, in the August heat was a bit annoying. Breakfast which, was included with our room was decent. On the second part of our stay we had another superior room but it had a different size( smaller) bed. After one night we requested another room and were given one and it had a larger bed. There seem to be no rhyme or reason as to what a superior room had for features. Two of the three rooms had only showers and one had a bathtub/shower combo that was almost impossible to get in and out of without slipping. There were a lot of little annoyances about our stay at the UNA hotel. For example: our room had free Internet but every day I had to go down to the lobby and get a new password and key for the wifi. This may seem trivial but it gets annoying after a couple of days. You could also only connect to their system with one computer or iphone at a time. This borders on absurd. While not a business hotel, many tourists now travel with computers and smartphones. Another small but frustrating thing was that there were no direction on the TV to find the English channels. While yes the hotel is in Italy, it is very common for hotels in non- English countries to offer English channels. I overheard another guest at the front desk asking how to access the English channels and found out that way. Another irksome area was the front desk. The front desk area can be quite chaotic at times. On many occasions stopping at the front desk always took more time than it should. I once waited for 10 minutes while the only 2 staff on the desk, dealt with the same customer. A few times while waiting for my wife, I watched how things were handled at the front desk. I watched one person wait patiently for quite a bit of time and then watched another person walk up to the desk and be served while the other person was still waiting. My sense here was that front of house seemed a bit disorganized at times. It is also not clear if one person is a concierge versus check in etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: opeboro
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the UNA hotel, expecting it to be small based on my last stay in Rome, but I was amazed at what I saw, it was better than I ever expected. I arrived in Rome with my wife and we both took the train from the airport to Termini and we were surprised at the proximity to Termini. we arrived at the check in counter and we were upgraded to a suite. I was amazed at how great the hotel looked and our room was no different. The bathroom was certainly more than we expected and it looked pristine. We had bathrobes available to us, a flat screen in the room, a shower stall and a bathtub stall, the list is endless. It was however disappointing that wifi was not free, we paid 3 Euros for 30 mins. Breakfast was excellent, with a great variety available from eggs, bacon and sausages, pastries of all sorts, again the list is long. The UNA hotel is close to several monuments, but the proximity to termini was the best, my wife and I were able to go to the Colosseum, and then to the Vatican city in one evening (we arrived at the hotel after 5pm). The next morning we visited the Basilica San Giovanni Laterano (we needed to be at the airport by 10:30 am), and we made great time. I will definitely stay here again and perhaps other UNA hotels if the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ALI-IRAN-Mashhad
Reviews.Content: Only a few steps from train station, metro station and bus station! means all of the rome is near you. very clean rooms. very good breakfast (not great but very good). No tea/cofee maker in rooms! very polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad... Reception staff terrible!”
Reviews.Author: lee p
Reviews.Content: Reception Staff... the biggest letdown of this hotel by far... having my debit card details stolen in the UK before arrival (advance booking for our room) I was sent an email from reception 4 days prior to arrival saying my payment had been declined and to ensure the booking was honoured... I was to email my card details back to the hotel. Not being happy with send my details via email I sent 1, 2 & 3 separate emails on consecutive days prior to our holiday... not once did the hotel reply. In the end I phoned the hotel direct & gave my new details over the phone. This lack of reply did not surprise me as I gave up sending or trying to send the hotels price promise guarantee form when first booked in May... Expedia were cheaper than the hotel direct (about 40 euros per night)... but could not confirm the extra bed for our daughter in the room, they only said she was included in a double room, the hotels own website though only lets you book a family room if a child is on the booking form... Upon arrival we headed to the front desk... not many smiles there... after handing over our reservation details we were told that access to our room was not yet permitted right up to the 2pm time... maybe me just being petty... but being made to wait in reception for 15 mins and then told you can go up now as soon as the clock struck 2.... We arrived at the hotel via the MA Express train from the airport... 28 euros for 2 adults and a child... the hotel is easily in view from the main entrance of the train station in Rome. Upon enquiring to reception about a taxi back to the airport we were informed it is 45 euros... 17 more than the train, but we thought why not we're on holiday etc... all was good until I informed reception we have 3 cases... one each... Oh... how big are they?... standard size was the reply... about 80cm tall etc... the guy behind the reception desk then said will they fit in a Mercedes!!!.. What size boot does the Mercedes have I replied!!! He just said... it's a Mercedes, you will not be allowed to use the back seat for a case as it has leather seats!! Honestly I could not believe it.... he then said we should really get a bigger taxi, but that will cost 55 euros... We got the 28 euro train again & it was fine... The room was ok, well laid out and clean, the bathroom however had a cracked glass top around the sink area and there was some pretty nasty back grime around the hand held shower head... obviously not cleaned for some time. A shame in such a new hotel. The second night we were there we had a constant flushing of water sound rushing above our hears all night... either the occupants above had a dodgy pizza or our room was sited next to a drainage pipe... either way the room was not well insulated from this sound. Breakfast was by far the best asset to this hotel, very friendly staff, nothing was too much trouble for these guys & girls... the spread was plentiful too, very nice quality produce... well done all round here, if only the reception staff shared their smiles & customer service skills! Unlimited Minibar & Wi-fi... 10 euros per night (only available at time of booking)... good value for the minibar (2x cans of beer, 3 cans of soft drinks, water, nuts & pringles... re-stocked daily... the wi-fi was another reception blank... it is only limited to one device.... so if you go as a family as we did only my iphone was permitted... (we used skype on it)... the daughters netbook & wifes iphone were not allowed to be connected as the password is only valid for one device... not that much of an issue but worth noting. The location is great and close to the numerous hop on hop off busses, we use the yello Roma Cristiana ones this time and had no problems, very reliable & all the headphone sockets worked!... the only downside on the location is late at night the area around the hotel can appear quite rough with poor lighting between the hotel & station, there were plenty of people standing around doorways, smoking, shouting & drinking etc... That said I never felt intimidated, just not too nice to walk around with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a European hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eric_S_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: We were there last October for 2 nights. The hotel was very up to date and good looking. Very hard to find this type of renovation in Italy. The breakfast was excelent as well. I thought the location was pretty good. Close enough to the subway and right next door to the Leonardo Express to the airport. be careful not to kill yourself getting out of the shower. It's about a 1.5 foot drop to the ground out of them. When you book, MAKE SURE YOU BOOK THE CORRECT TYPE OF ROOM! I booked a "classic single" for my wife and I. Little did I know that that means there is only ONE PERSON allowed in the room. Period. When I walked up to the front desk to check in, my wife was with me. They refused to even allow my wife up to the room without taking her passport to make sure that she came back downstairs. We were VERY concerned with this but what other choice did we have? It was 10pm and we had just got to Rome. What was worse, the only room they had available for the night was a Suite for something like 800 extra Euros per night. No thanks. I even offered to pay for an additional person but they refused. We Reluctantly gave them her passport so she could help me get our stuff up to the room. We went back downstairs, got her passport, and headed out to eat dinner. When we got back, there was a different person working the desk so we managed to get up to the room and stay there. The only reason we did this was because we had no other choice. It was that or sleep on the street. I can't blame the staff for this mistake but It would be nice if their website made it very clear what a "classic single" is. In America, a "single" room does not mean that you can't put two people in it. I do give the service a rating of "1" though because it is NEVER appropriate to ask a guest to give up their passport under any circumstance

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Close to the Main Train Station (Urban)”
Reviews.Author: PhotographyBro
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Hotel UNA ROMA for two night on a quick stop in Rome while on Vacation. This is a nice hotel but in a very urban area. Check-in was fast and efficient and the staff was friendly and professional. Like most places in Rome, the staff was about getting you checked in and to your room.. If you are looking for warm and fuzzy, you need to stay in a resort. The room was nice, I received an upgrade to an executive KING. The bathroom was clean with the exception of the shower area. As mentioned in previous reviews, the venting the bathroom is poor and causing the drywall in the shower area to crack and paint chip. But as I mentioned before, it's urban Rome and not a resort and for what you pay here, the room is reasonable. This is a new property and I am sure that the drywall is being addressed. I did not get to eat at the restaurant or take advantage of the free breakfast. There are restaurants in the area (Go out the front door of the hotel, take a left, and walk about 4 blocks) and they were quite good and very reasonable. I booked online and was surprised that when I arrived that booking granted me FREE internet for my stay. Overall I was very happy at the hotel UNA. (Remember... It's not a resort)

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, i would recommend to anyone visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: Natashaa1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in August 2011. We had a superior room with a balcony. The Room was spacious, well decorated and the bathroom was very nice. The hotel was easy to find and in a good location to explore Rome with many restaurants nearby and good travel links, although we ended up walking to most places. The hotel was very modern, clean and the staff helpful. The breakfast was great. I Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mindful_Travels
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel from the moment you find it. It is not situated on a busy or main street. It is walking distance to the train station. We had a great room on the top floor with a large balcony. The room was very clean and we had a great nights sleep. Would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful except for the noise! Adjoining rooms are streetside only!”
Reviews.Author: KingCityDancemom
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and stayed here for 4 nights before a cruise out of Chivi. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor we booked through hotels.ca and pre-paid at a non-refundable rate. My booking was followed by and immediate email requesting adjoining rooms on the couryard side. I was emailed back promplty acknoledging my request. I thought I was all set. When we checked it, the adjoining rooms were unavailable. Being tired and hot after a long flight we didn't fuss too much but when we got to the rooms I decided to got back to the desk and made a fuss about not having connecting rooms. I simply did not feel comfortable not having direct access to the kids at night and did not appreciate that the room was not ready the way I had requested it after booking a non-refundable rate. After 30 minutes or so we got the connecting rooms but on the street side. Apparantly there are no connecting rooms available on the courtyard side. If you have a family and want to be conectected, the trade off is the noise coming from the steetcars entering the station. I suggested earplugs for the guests might be a nice idea. Aside from a less than stellar check-in, the rest of our experience was lovely. Beautiful and modern rooms, lovely breakfast and courteous staff. We travelled by foot and cabs mostly. We took the subway once but only as part of a waling tour we book with rome experience tours. It cost us no more than 10 to 15 Euro to get enywhere by taxi depending on traffic. There were lots of nice restauraunts in the area, our favorite was Elettra which was 2 doors down from an Onda Green laundramat. We did laundry at Onda green and enjoyed a glass of wine next door while waiting for our clothes. it was very pleasant. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Elisia29
Reviews.Content: We had read that the area surrounding Termini station wasn't the best but we wanted to stay somewhere accessible to different transport and this place turned out to be perfect. We were even within walking distance to the collosseum so that was a bonus!! Included in the rate was breakfast which was quite simple but I really enjoyed the fresh bread rolls in the mornings. We didn't eat in the restaurant, just had coffees and light meals. There are several decent restaurants that are really close by. The staff were quite friendly and very helpful with questions about sites and restaurants. Overall it was a great place for my husband and I to stay at and we would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “hotel not recomended”
Reviews.Author: syrter
Reviews.Content: Room only available at 2pm, shower dirty, staff rude, too much expensive for the benefit

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiberiu85
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel I ever stayed. Clean, comfort, kindness of staff.

Reviews.Title: “UNA Hotel was awesome”
Reviews.Author: Riodesmoke
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Very new and clean. We arranged a pick up from the airport as we were not familiar with the area. The pickup was on time and a very nice Mercedes picked us up without incident. We arrived at the hotel which is right around the block from the Roma Termini. Not the best neighborhood but we did not have any issues whatsoever. The hotel staff was absolutely great and I couldn't have asked for anything more as far as the hotel itself goes. The restaurant (Ristorante Prive) was not all that good though. When we ate there our first night we were the only people there and I now know why. They do server free breakfast every morning on the other hand which was very good. They will give good recommendations to local food venues as well. We also got upgraded to a suite with a balcony for no charge and the rooms were small but excellent. I would definitely stay here again. Only thing I would be wary of is the tours that are booked from the hotel (Carrani Tours). They can be good but are very expensive. DEFINITELY look into staying that this hotel if in the Rome area and want a close location to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MiamiDre
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights after a Rome cruise and were very pleased with the hotel, friendly and helpful staff, very close to Termini Station (1 Block away) and very clean and comfortable. Very modern rooms with flat screen TV and spacious shower- also, they had a great breakfast buffet. Only downside (and am being picky with this) is that they didn’t have a 110 V outlet in the room and did not have adapters so we could not charge any of our electronics before the flight. This was our first time in Europe so I don’t know if this is the standard for hotels there. Besides this, everything was great, would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “good location near train station”
Reviews.Author: Nancy_39_and_holding
Reviews.Content: the rooms were clean and though the hotel seemed fairly busy, the halls were quiet. though the front desk could use a concierge, the staff were friendly . great access to the metro and very walkable to many Rome sights. for the price, it was a good choice and I would reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, modern and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: wrocki
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at this hotel and one of the same chain in Milan in 2009 and once again it matched or exceeded our expectations. The compromise is the location but there is a garage under the hotel and transport links are excellent. The breakfast is outstanding but the doorman could be more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Rome July 2011”
Reviews.Author: pusanyc7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a quick jump around the corner from the Roma Termi which was great and it's located not far from all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: D6AMS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Una for four nights in August. Two on our own and two as a part of a tour. Hotel is recently refurbished and is all done out in white marble style. Very nice and most spacious. The room however, was anything but. It did have a very high ceiling which was nice. Unfortunately, the room was possibly higher than it was wide or deep. Okay, putting the room size gripe to one side, the rainfall shower was lovely, there was also a separate shower head, but no bath. The location of the hotel, near the main railway station was great for us being only 10 minutes walk or so from the Trevi Fountain, Colosseum, Pantheon and Piazza Navona. Another nice touch at the Una is that breakfast is included, and the coffee was excellent. We also had a 'French Balcony' that looked nicely over the street and restaurant behind the hotel. In summary, a good hotel, good location, good breakfast, good room but very small and not cheap, but then, Rome isn't cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Strawb12
Reviews.Content: Myself, wife and daughter stayed twice in June '11 and loved the location, the environment and service. top class hotel in a city that can produce a few shockers as i can attest.The guest gets what they pay for in a four star hotel and more. if the budget suits or you can afford a little luxury for a stay in Rome then you won't be disappointed. i would stay again and may!!

Reviews.Title: “Big and spacious and very central location”
Reviews.Author: Vivienne B
Reviews.Content: This was great because it was so close to the metro and to everything else. We were able to walk to many tourist spots and therefore nothing escaped our vision, as there is literally something to see in every nook and cranny of Rome. Beware of very cheap restaurants. They are very tourist oriented and do not do justice to the awesome Italian cuisine elsewhere in the city. Highly recommend this hotel. Very comfy and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel close to train station.”
Reviews.Author: ACC4
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a wondeful breakfast buffet. The room was very clean and modern. It was nice having a terrace to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, great service, breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: westcoast78
Reviews.Content: Lovely, modern hotel located one block from Termini rail station. Professional, helpful staff. Stylish, clean rooms that are well-maintained. Breakfast buffet is a wonderful extra...so many choices. Front desk made some spot-on restaurant recommendations. For a slight splurge, hotel can arrange a private car for you.....not much more than a taxi. The neighborhood is in transition, but we always felt safe. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cecille C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and 4 days with 2 young children, 6 & 11 y/o. We had requested for a connecting room which was not available and we were offered 2 rooms on the same floor but not connecting. With children as young as ours, this was not a feasible situation. The receptionist said she could not downgrade our reservation which we were willing to do just as long as the rooms were connecting or even next to each other. It is not possible, she says. So, respecting the fact that connecting rooms were not guaranteed and merely a request, we decided that we will stay the first night at the non-discounted rate (discounted rate had a minimum stay of 3 nights) and look for alternate accommodations the next day. The lady receptionist went off on us and told us that we just arrived and why were we talking about moving to another hotel and told us to sit in the lobby while she looks for a better solution. Well, we waited for approx 25 mins in the lobby directly in front of her, while she continued to check other guests in. Finally, she approaches us and tells us nicely that she was going on a break and that another colleague will be helping us. That actually worked for us, since the other lady, Mara, was very pleasant and gracious and upgraded us to an executive suite without additional costs. Past that, we thoroughly enjoyed our spacious room that had a king sized bed and an adjoining living room w/ a sofa queen bed and the amenities were great including turn down service. French sliding doors in between the master and the living room gave us some privacy. The bathroom was so spacious, it included a tub/shower combination on one side and a full sized glassed-in shower on the right! It would not be right if I did not mention the BREAKFAST. It was extensive, delicious, and offered gluten-free breads etc. The breakfast STAFF were so courteous and efficient! We were greeted warmly and did not have long to wait. The male manager was so attentive and directed the breakfast staff so well that my daughter said he reminded her of a conductor in an orchestra! The location was great, only one block from the Termini and all tourist sites were so accessible, even to the Vatican City. (Metro air conditioning was great compared to Paris but the terminals are dirtier. Rome Metro was so easy to use- literally an 'X" ). We had 2 young children and our safety was NEVER an issue. The area was so well lighted. In fact, we even walked to the Termini and used the Metro around 9pm to go back to the city center. My suggestion to the hotel is to improve communication between staff in the reception area since the lady checking us out was charging us way more than what was agreed upon.
