We told her to speak with Mara about it since she made the arrangements for us, only then did she believe us and charged us for the original amount. Oh, well. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone! Thanks, UNA Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Big bed, little room”
Reviews.Author: Igotafeeling
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the train, but not as fun of a neighborhood as staying closer to the central part of Rome. The bathroom was very nice and everything seems really new. The airconditioning worked great. The breakfast was enormous and had several varied choices. We stayed during a weekend and checked out on Monday morning and several trains went by on Monday morning, making a lot of noise... but we were not bothered as we were packing to check out anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: mobi11
Reviews.Content: I must say this is a great hotel for any country , modern, clean and very close to the station . The service is also excellent , we needed to leave early for an excursion one day and the hotel offered to have take away breakfasts available free of charge - now thats what I call service .If you fancy a Chinese meal one evening LA Giunca on Via Daniele Manin serves great food at a very reasonable price-Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, good value...”
Reviews.Author: Blubbalicious
Reviews.Content: Pros: VERY near Termini. Modern decor. Decent size room (superior), spacious bathroom. Good breakfast buffet. Efficient service. All in all good value for money. Cons: Low on personality, WiFi ridiculously expensive, and the "business centre" leaves a lot to be desired. If you want to stay near Termini, you can't beat the UNA. Some people find the area immediately surrounding the station quite dodgy at night. If you prefer, you can always avoid Termini after nightfall and use the metro station at Piazza della Repubblica., two blocks west. Service was efficient and polite, not a lot of personal touches, but very professional. The room was comfortable in every way, especially the large bathroom. The window faced the courtyard, not very exciting, but quiet. The shower was especially excellent. Bed a bit on the hard side after my taste, but the wife loved it. Our stay was at the end of the holiday, and we needed to use the business facilities for checking in on our flight home, and prepare for work. The price for an hour's worth of WiFi-connection was atrocious, especially since the computers provided in the business centre in the lobby were so painfully slow it all took longer than expected. The printer had barely any toner left, which didn't help either. We muddled through in the end, however. All in all, not perfect, not chock-full of charm, but very clean, comfortable and practical. We will most likely return.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Jinky T
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in Rome, very close to the termini station about 3 minutes walk. Clean room with all the amenities you need soap, lotion, shampoo and even slippers. They change the towels everyday. Breakfast has a lot of choices. Good coffee and the hot chocolate is excellent too. Staff are very friendly and attentive.The manager is very good too they gave us complimentary cocktail drinks the night of my daughters birthday. Dinner is good as well in the hotel, good price too. On our last day we left our luggage in the hotel after check out so that we can still go around....i think this is an excellent service to offer..Overall we love it and we'll be back soon. The only downside is the bathroom with a little mold where the sealers are... but otherwise very clean and spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tigerbo7
Reviews.Content: UNA was a good last minute choice. Although a little expensive, there are cheaper and we could have looked longer but, we have been to Rome a few times and for our purposes this time, the UNA was great. UNA is located a few blocks from the train station near Piazza Repubblica which is perfect if you are only in Rome for a few days. It is a beautiful building and the rooms are modern, clean and the beds are very comfortable. The doors to the room are sensational! The bathrooms are large and very well appointed with a giant bathtub. Unfortunately the drains are very slow. The wi-fi is not free. We arrived by train and the walk to the hotel was about 10 mins. It was very easy. The staff were very helpful with many good suggestions on restaurants, taxis and a bus schedule to get my daughter back to her job in another part of Italy. All the major sites are within walking distance. I suggest the market at night along the Tiber and the Trasteverre area for cafes and dinner, Farnesse piazza and the jewish ghetto

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Cost/Benefit ratio”
Reviews.Author: sparodi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Una Roma for 4 nights and it was very pleasent, staff was very helpfull, modern furniture and great breakfast. Unfortunately we stayed at the first floor and there was a little noise from the street, specially the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, convenient for Termini Station and sites East of the river.”
Reviews.Author: Mamadear1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3-6th August. Lovely room, we went for superior, but our daughter and her friend were in a standard and that was just as good, a tiny bit smaller. Handy for visiting sites, though a little further to Travestere and Vatican. very charming helpful staff. I would consider 6€ per hour for Internet quite expensive, but we went for the 10€ /day for free wi-fi and minibar, bookable in advance and possibly at reception on arrival, but check that. 2 more days here but I'm loving it so far!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a poor restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: Jnsswe
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect and with a great value, except for the restaurant, the food was overcooked, tasteless and looked awful, even the recommended wine was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice personal, goot breakfast and very expensive internet !”
Reviews.Author: godamir
Reviews.Content: When we came to the hotel, we had for the first 2 days a room with a shower that was molded. We asked to change the room and we got one that was really great. Breakfast was really great and we loved it. The personal in the breakfast-restaurant was nice and the coffe was great. Just one of the leading-receptionists was not so friendly. She said me that I can go to the Internet-Caffe if I dont like the internet in the hotel. And that for the price of 6 EUR for every DEVICE and HOUR. I had to pay 12 EUR for every hour if I would like to use my PC and my iPhone in the hotel. And 18EUR per hour if my daughter would like to use her iPad. Imagine that I booked German Internet over 3G because it was cheaper.. Thats not the european standard.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, excellent location and good breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: jules_foreva
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October 2010 and must say that this hotel was excellent. It is right by Termini station which is ideal for the airport. We chose the wrong exit from the station so use the main one, near the bus station bit and then you will be OK (the hotel was UNA on the side so you will see it clearly). The room was ideal with an excellent bathroom, it was very clean and the staff were very helpful. The food at breakfast was ideal and just what you wanted before a busy day siteseeing. The hotel is ideally placed, with buses and the metro at Termini. The tram line passes the hotel so could be noisy if you were near that but we got used to it and was OK for us. Don't think there was a better hotel for us honestly, loved it here.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Modern Hotel. Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: 7csailor
Reviews.Content: This is a very smart modern hotel and good value for the money located in a quiet area close to the Termini train station. The staff are all very polite and efficient. In a previous review I had read a complaint about possible noise from the tram line that runs outside the hotel, so I made sure we got a room at the back. This was very quiet and luxuriously appointed with a lovely large bathroom with a bath. The breakfast was very good indeed with a good selection of fruits breads pastries juices and cereals. The scrambled egg and bacon did not look so nice though but the rest was great. There are some nice reasonably priced restaurants near the hotel. I found the hotel to be a little far from the centre to walk so we got taxis everywhere. You can get a train from the airport but we didn’t want the humping of cases on and off the train and through the station. (You are too close to get a taxi from the station just one block down from Termini) So it would have been lugging cases down the street to the hotel. We decided to get a taxi from Fumicino airport. This is fixed rate of 40 Euros which is not bad for the convenience. You have to get a ticket from a desk just before you go out the door of the airport to make sure you get the 40 Euro fixed rate, otherwise the taxi will be on the meter. The Hotel can arrange a luxury car back to the airport for 45 Euro which we took on departure. Impressions of Rome: Visit the main attractions about two in the afternoon to avoid the queues. We only queued for 15 mins at St Peters and the same at the Colliseum. The Vatican Museum we walked straight in. You may as well give the Trevi fountain a miss as it’s just a horde of tourists. The Sistine chapel was fantastic and the highlight of our stay. Be sure to read up all about the painting on the ceiling before you go to truly appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LanarkshireTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over a year ago but just realised I did not review it. I booked based on recommendations from TA. Could not have asked for more. We were given a free upgraded to a superior room on arrival and could not believe the quality of the room. Great decor, very fresh and modern and much larger than any other room we have had in Rome. Lovely hotel, friendly staff and the breakfast is great. It is a 2 min walk from Termini but still easily accessible to all the main sites (10-15 min walk). We liked it that much we are staying here for our wedding in Rome in a few months. It offers reasonable value when compared to hotels of similar standards in Rome. It would be good to have tea making facilities in room though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very nearby trainstation, distance to city centre also ok.”
Reviews.Author: rspronck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well groomed. Nice and clean rooms, we slept very well. This is quite a quiet location, but still central. You can walk to the city center, we did that 4 days and didn't bother. I would still recommend not to do everything by foot. Breakfast is also fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: Sonia_Shen
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel. The staff can speak English well and loves to provide us useful information about Rome. There is one day that we met a strike. The nice staff suggested us to visit the colosseo by walk and showed us how to get there. It did save us a lot of time. Besides, the room space is enough for two adults with two big baggages. As for location, it is near the Rome termini so we can go the sightseeing spots easily by bus or by metro.

Reviews.Title: “A taste of Italy”
Reviews.Author: mistergLongIsland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was new or newly remodeled, very 1st rate. Very secure electronic entrance to rooms, electronic controls for all lighting and A/C. Rooms extremely spacious especially for Hotels in the city. Excellent location near tour stops, rail station, main parts of city, etc. Hotel staff was very pleasent and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A keeper on my list of places to stay.”
Reviews.Author: bbrhk
Reviews.Content: A new-ish (a refurbished building) hotel that 2 mins to the Termini station. The rooms are clean, spacious (we booked the Executive rooms), well fitted out, more modern and stylishly furnished, a business hotel that's efficiently managed. The front desk can get a little busy as they manage all affairs from check-ins, to concierge duties. The in-house restaurant does an excellent breakfast buffet and has a respectable menu for lunch and dinner. Food quality is very good! Wi-fi connections throughout the hotel but at cost - suggest the 'minutes' package instead of the 24hr package if you're spending more time out during the day exploring the city. Excellent location if you need to use the trains though a little far from the main sights of Rome. Easily recommended and will definitely return to.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneFarrington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the UNA Hotel Roma for 3 nights in June before travelling onto Venice, the hotel is ideally placed just around the corner from the main train termini so commuting is really not a problem! It is a new hotel and is decorated beautifully, we had a very stylish room with plenty of room for the 3 of us, in fact it was one of the nicest rooms I have stayed in, the bathroom was equally nice. The only outside noise came from the trams going passed but this was not an issue. The breakfast was mostly continental with a few hot items eggs, bacon etc and was perfectly adequate. The hotel is within walking distance of most of the sights in Rome but there is always the metro for tired legs at the end of the day! Staff on reception were very nice, providing local maps and taxis to and from the airport. The bar is a little expensive but I guess you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: ActRegular_traveller
Reviews.Content: We were there as part of a tour group and we were in room 431 for 2 nights. The hotel is very central, close to the main railway station. Our room was very comfortable with nice high ceilings and a modern fit-out. (Personally, I wasn’t wild about the synthetic alligator skin on the bed-head and wardrobe, but I’m conservative in things like that). Our double bed was 2 large singles pushed together – very comfortable. Black-out curtains were very effective. A small bar fridge with just enough room for a couple of small bottles of water purchased at the convenience store around the corner. Bathroom has a hairdryer. Large flatscreen TV. Internet for a fee. No tea or coffee making facilities. Safe. Bathroom is configured as a wet room – and it sure got wet! The shower area is almost level with the bathroom floor and apparently not quite the lowest part as we had streams of water heading off in 2 directions under the shower curtain. The towel rail appears as though it should be heated but wasn’t (we were there in Summer). Tour groups eat breakfast separately from other guests. Breakfast was adequate – some stuff ran out – and the breakfast area is strangely organised . I understood from others on the tour who arrived early as normal guests that the normal breakfast area is better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Helpful Staff, New and Modern”
Reviews.Author: Tangolover10
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after quite an extensive research on TA for hotels in Rome, and we are glad to have made this choice as it was exactely what we wanted: a modern hotel , confortable room, good and helplful staff, etc.. Breakfast was rich and with alot of variety ! Also, an inmportant thing is that the hotel is situated very close to Termini station which made our life easier to connect with Rome's transport system as it's a hub for the metro and buses. The location, was therefore perfect in that sense, although the neighbourhood close to Termini is not the cleanest but we used the Hotel for accomodation really and the Hotel is just 2 min walk from the station , so really nothing to worry about!! we 'll definitely be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent food at the hotel's restaurant”
Reviews.Author: milva84
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great location. Can be a bit noisy if you are not used to the trolleys passing by every 5 minutes if you get a side street room. After requesting a room in a different part of the hotel we got a room overlooking courtyard. MORE Spacious and very quiet! FOOD AND SERVICE were outstanding and prices were very reasonable.I would definitely recommend this hotel and don't forget to eat there! Just remember try to get a room on the 5th or 6th floor away from the streets! AHA one more thing most of the street restaurants will charge you 'coperto' which is 'an eating out charge 2 euro per person so keep that in mind. The Una restaurant does not charge that. The hotel however will charge you turist tax = 2 euro per person per day. Monika

Reviews.Title: “Clean and New”
Reviews.Author: Ishpudejko
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the UNA Hotel Roma. Overall the service was excellent and the rooms were comfortable and modern. The A/C worked well during the day, but at night the hotel seemed to overide our settings and increase the temperature so that we woke up to a warm room. The breakfast was okay, nothing special but adequate. The location was very good as we were very near the train/subway terminal. The staff were courteous and helpful. We would certainly consider staying at the UNA again. - Igor

Reviews.Title: “A little more than dissapointed.”
Reviews.Author: AppyDez
Reviews.Content: My husband and i traveled through several cities in Italy and we chose Rome to be our splurge city, after staying at a few small old hotels i was really looking forward to staying here. Everything was perfect upon arrival, we checked in pretty early about 7 am and they took our bags since our room was not ready, they gave me and my husband a map of the city, a few pointers, and told us we could go have breakfast. We went out for the day and came back several hours later, our bags had been moved so we went to our room everything seemed perfect still until i went to take a shower. There was mold in several places in the shower although it looked clean. My husband and i agreed to stay in the room for the night and ask the next morning for a different room, the next morning, they sent up a manager who came in and looked and didn't look surprised. She upgraded our room and moved us with out any hassle. But when we got to our new room we still had even more mold in the shower. and on the bathroom sink faucet. It was a really nice hotel with a great staff, the breakfast was great one of the biggest i saw while in Italy. But we had much cleaner rooms for more than half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful white, clean and sparkly”
Reviews.Author: badabing51
Reviews.Content: White, shiny, and sparkly is the way I would describe this hotel. It was the chosen hotel for Rome by our Insight Tour and I can see why. It was very comfy and definitely a 4 star. Looks like just a doorway from outside but wow when you enter and then enter your room...wow! Would definitely recommend it. Close walking distance to so much history too!

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant stay. We will return!”
Reviews.Author: HelenC1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for the past few nights, what a pleasure. We spent extra for a superior double and it was well worth it. Hotel was spotlessly clean and all modern fittings. Breakfast was so lovely and fresh that I'm missing it now I'm home. Overall we truly loved it and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, great service, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ozaqua
Reviews.Content: Great location near the main station. My room was immaculate, modern and well appointed. Staff helpful, and a fantastic buffet breakfast included

Reviews.Title: “Really great service and convenient”
Reviews.Author: TLunedi
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. We were fortunate to get a top floor room with an outdoor balcony which made for great evenings. The hotel is close enough to the tourist attractions for exploring Rome and is ultra convenient near the train station and Metro stop. The staff made perfect recommendations for dinner each evening and even made our reservations. The staff was very helpful and the complimentary breakfast was good. My only negative would be that the mattresses were a bit uncomfortable but I am spoiled by my Beautyrest Pillowtop at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomdations and location for the price”
Reviews.Author: KAST223
Reviews.Content: Clean stylish rooms, nice staff, large buffet breakfast, good location. For the price I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Right near station”
Reviews.Author: RJhonestcomments
Reviews.Content: We sayed here for 3 nights in June 2011 and found it excellent. So easy to find when you arrive into termini station. 2 minutes to the bus 2 minutes to station and 15 mins from sites etc. Room was clean, shiny and bathroom had lovely shower. paid a little more tha budgeted but well worth it. Would go again . !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel67_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the UNA hotel in Rome for 9 days and just loved it. Room was a little small compared to NA standards but bed was extremely comfortable and there was lots of closet space. Bathroom was large. Very clean. Loved the wood flooring (hate carpet in hotels!). Beautiful design. Buffet breakfast was included and it was very good. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Never hesitated to help us and they were never rude compared to a lot of restaurants around Rome. Situed in central Rome - everything is within walking distance. Quiet for downtown. Tram passes closeby but it just makes a soft roaring sound - like a plane overhead. After a few days, you don't hear it anymore. Would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel in Roma near termini”
Reviews.Author: Woolley2004
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks more like an office building from the street but step inside and you enter an oasis. Top fixtures, service and the little extras that turn a stay from good to great. A room upgrade upon arrival was a treat and nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel.......top class”
Reviews.Author: Aussie40
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel, apparently the location has gone down in the past couple of years according to our taxi driver but it was accessible to all the things we wanted to do - the usual site seeing things in Rome. Breakfast was fantastic. Would highly recommend this hotel to anybody. They had a great bar that was open till late where u always got snacks with yr drinks.........very obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: triptips007
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! It's literally a block from Termini Rail Station, and we walked everywhere. The place is immaculate - from the rooms, service, and the delicious breakfast in the morning! If I go back to Rome, I will definitely stay here again. If you don't like being around tourists or crave a "local" experience, this is not the place for you (lots of fellow Americans here, but I don't mind one bit)! One downside is expensive internet. I had to send a couple work emails on this vacation and paid 3 Euros for 30 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to base yourself in Rome”
Reviews.Author: T_A_FMF34
Reviews.Content: Una Hotel won't win any prizes for being unique or having great character - but if you're looking for a hotel which is modern, comfortable, clean with great service, then you'll really like Una Hotel. We really loved coming back to the hotel after a busy day in Rome and finding a cool room (excellent air con) with really comfy beds, great bathroom and modern fittings. We also had a lovely big balcony. The service from the staff is excellent and the breakfast good. The location is great (the area did not seem to be dodgy like some people say) and we enjoyed using the metro to get round easily (only a few mins walk from the hotel). We thought Una Hotel was a great choice for a good price in a city which seems to be full of overpriced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel; strongly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: AlpBot
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in UNA Hotel for 5 nights, with our 2 years old child, in May. Loved the hotel for many reasons: The hotel is new, clean and very very well furnished in modern style. Rooms are large enough (for Rome standards), comfy, have wooden floors (no dirty carpets), gives the feeling of a 5-star hotel, and in-line with the price. The staff is excellent and very helpful. The breakfast is really nice, has many options, and sufficient. The location of the hotel is good, quiet and has no safety or security concerns. All historic sites are within the walking range, but I recommend bringing your child's stroller. We didn't use the public transportation, but the main terminal for trains (Termini Station), city-tour buses and subway are only 100m away. Don't forget to ask for a private car for going back to the airport, as it costs less than the taxis, and much more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sudexpress
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel (opened spring 2010). Huge rooms with lots of amenities. Huge bathrooms. Silent rooms, excellent bed and good choise of pillows. High ceilings in both. Reminiscent of the 19th century Grand Terminal hotel's. Great location: 2 minutes walk to Termini train and bus stations to everywhere in Rome or Italy. Room with one extra bed (good one) for a child still have space to move around. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Super surprise”
Reviews.Author: Alpfam
Reviews.Content: Recent visit: well located. Helpful staff. Nice rooms. Pity, no free wifi ( the only negative). Great breakfast. Easy to get around. Excellent restaurant suggestions from the staff. Great visit. Much enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: adelaidefc2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed in April 2011. Location is very good, a short walk from central station. Walking to tourist sites might be a little far for some, but the metro is easily accessible from the station. Rooms are excellent. Very clean, very comfortable beds/pillows. Breakfast buffet is absolutely outstanding, one of the best I've seen. Delicious home-made pastries and just about everything else you could ever want. You won't need lunch :) No free wifi (or free internet at all) is the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Una Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Evaeli
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at UNA Hotel! Arrived around 3pm to check in & was promptly upgraded from a superior room to a Executive room, which was a nice treat. Check in was very easy with the receptionist giving us a map of Rome & a quick run-through of all the 'must visit' sites which was very handy & helpful. The hotel is modern & we enjoyed the walk to our room. The hallways are a nice sight with the big bold room doors each illuminated from above by cleverly placed lights. Our room was clean & modern. large with a walk in area, large bedroom - Lounge area & a stylish bathroom with bidet & bath/shower. Clever lighting, especially in the bathroom. We loved coming back to our room after a long day tramping through Rome. The aircon was always handy & we never heard a peep from any of the surrounding rooms, which is always good. Buffet breakfast was ok. Not the best we had in Europe. I found myself reaching for the packaged cereal as I found the hot & cold selection not to my liking. We also missed breakfast a couple of days & tried a few of the local cafes. We too were worried about the location after reading of reports that the area surrounding was 'seedy'. But we found the area very handy to the metro. Termini is in the middle of the 2 metro lines a & b. So it was so handy when getting to all the sites. We also enjoyed the shopping & resturaunts within the termini station. They have market shops, clothes stores & dairies right outside the hotel. There are also a few Internet cafes in the area if you don't not to pay Hotel Unas steep wifi charges (around €6 euros for a hour All over, we had a pleasant stay at Hotel Una & would not hesitate staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SBHgirl
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the UNA Hotel Roma. The hotel itself is modern and clean with nice amenities in the room. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast offered many selections to choose from. The location could not be beat- a 2 mintue walk from the Termini station. There were lots of restaurants in the neighborhood, but we chose to head to other areas of town for dinner and always walked back to the UNA. We did pay 3E for 30 minutes of wifi, but did not consider it an issue. We thought the UNA was an excellent value for the price and would stay there again any time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Nigel M
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in the Una Hotel Rome & can reccomend it to all as a very comfortable & chic hotel. It looks new, our room was on the top (6th) floor with a balcony that ran the full length of the room, no great views but nice to sit out on & relax. The room was one of the largest we have seen with a bathroom to match, a bath large enough for 2!!, a superb overhead rain shower plus an additional shower, bidet, radio/TV control, heated towel rail and a PHONE?? Lots of room to move around, a KING size bed, mini bar, free digital safe, a new flat screen TV, looked about a 30inch model, our only gripe was the lack of english channels, only CNN, but hey who goes to Rome to watch TV. Cannot report on the restaurant as we dined out except for the includeed Breakfast Buffet. The menu outside of the restaurant looked very comprehensive, I am sure you would be more than satisfied if you wanted to dine in. The Breakfast was excellent, very good choice, hot & cold food, DIY toast etc, wide range of fruits, yogurts, cereals, pastries, croissants, etc, etc. The service was very good, all of the staff were very friendly & helpful, as were the reception & bar staff, cannot fault them at all. The location of the hotel, one street away from the main rail station,(Termini) & Metro, is at the top of Via Cavour & very convenient for the whole sightseeing process. We did have a few doubts when looking at other reviews which painted the area as seedy & not very nice, whereas the reality is different. The Colloseum & Forum is a downhill 10 to 15 minute stroll, admittably the return is uphill but you can hop on the Metro which is right outside of the Colloseum & for 1 euro & 2 stops, 5 minutes, you are back at the hotel. A bit of advice for the Forum & Colloseum is to use the Forum entrance which is opposite the end of Via Cavour, 1 ticket gets you into both sites, also if you are a senior show your Passport or photo ID, I used my driving licence, & we got in for 10 euros for both of us, the full price is 12 euros each. Do the Forum first & Colloseum 2nd, when you get into the Colloseum there are 3 lines, 1 for groups on left, 1 for pay at the gate on right, go up the one in the middle & you should, like us, not queue at all just walk sraight in. Same for the Vatican, 1 euro each takes you to Ottoviano, 6 stops from the Termini, 10 minutes, a short stroll takes you to the Vatican Museum for the Sistine & to St Peters square for the Basilica. In fact you can use the Metro to see all of the sites & keep the walking to a minimum & at a low price. Have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: maria-teogreece
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, new and clean. The breakfast is quite good. The only problem we faced was tha problematic shower. The staff was very helpful. Be careful with room service because it costs a lot to get something in the room. also the location is not the best and we were a bit uncomfortable when returning late at night. on the whole though it has been a wonderful experience to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: iheart2trvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the UNA Hotel Roma in May for 3 nights! It is a 2 minute walk to the Termini station which was quite nice as we had several large pieces of luggage! The hotel is very new and clean and the staff was always very helpful. The room was very spacious and had a nice large flat screen T.V. We enjoyed a large buffet spread every morning for breakfast! The hotel was about a 15 minute walk to the Colosseum and a little further from other sites. Only complaint would be the additional charge for Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: LOU186565
Reviews.Content: Staff could not be more helpful, or polite. From booking taxis to general enquiries, nothing was too much trouble. Hotel room was first class, quiet, air conditioned and good quality linen. Bathroom was top notch and had an excellent shower the length of the room with great power in the actual shower. Particular thanks to Anna in the restaurant when she found out a member of the party was celebrating a birthday she arranged for complimentary cocktails for the group...so thanks Anna... made our trip...Location was great for all the sights and especially the metro station just across the road...Would not normally recommend hotels but this one was first class...The breakfast choice was brilliant. A great start for a day sight seeing..we just loved the city...

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel but with some housekeeping issues.”
Reviews.Author: emilyq
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with spacious (especially for Europe) rooms and a varied and extensive breakfast. The location is convenient to the train station but the area is otherwise charmless. This would have been a five star review had it not been for issues with housekeeping. After our first night we left the hotel at around 10 AM and were gone for about five hours, with the "please clean" sign up, but when we returned, no one had come in. We opted to go without service that night. The second day we again left out the sign, as well as a small tip for the housekeeper with a thank-you note. When we returned the room was still uncleaned but the tip was gone and the thank you note was crumpled in the overflowing trash can. When we complained at the desk they were unconcerned, simply offering to send someone up to clean the room. I found this to be an unsettling experience and will make us decide to stay elsewhere when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The most expensive hotel I have stayed at in my life.”
Reviews.Author: Digimeister
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day before our tour started and the cost was a whopping $386 AUD for one room for one night. And that's for a hotel just down the road from Rome Termini. The hotel was excellent and you could not fault the service nor the breakfast. But charging for Internet after paying so much for the room was a little on the rude side. I would have expected free WIFI as a minimum. Would not recommend hotel as value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Twice!”
Reviews.Author: Philonous_XXI
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one block away from Roma Termini. It is a new hotel with good, clean rooms and good breakfast. We easily walked down Via Cavour to the Colosseum in approximately 10-15 minutes. The Spanish Steps are also not far from the hotel and we also walked there in about 25 minutes. We stayed at the hotel twice and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Hotel, Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sebil
Reviews.Content: WE have stay ther 5 nights with my wife and little children. Location, breakfast is ver good. Hotel was clean.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jamesyp1976
Reviews.Content: Did 2 nights in Rome before going on a Med cruise, and picked this hotel after reading the reviews. They were absolutely right... this hotel was glorious! Our room had a big balcony (not all do) with sun loungers, and was very contemporary, with a massive bed, flat screen TV (no english channels) and a big walk in shower. We had a view over Rome, and could see the Vatican etc. Breakfast buffet had something for everyone. 100 metres from the Termini station, from which you can go straight to the airport for 14 euros (no stops) or pick-up the hop-on bus tour. Staff were great at this hotel, however people in Rome are noticably ruder than anywhere else i've been in Europe. This didn't spoil my trip at all though. My personal opinion is that the myth that pizza here is amazing, is just a myth! LOVED THIS HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “XLNT service and hotel with nice buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SveziaUna
Reviews.Content: Everything at this hotel was great. Check-in went smooth and even more surprising we were upgrade to a Junior Suite - thanks. + Hotel standard is super + Hotel Staff too + Buffet breakfast really good for being Italy + Location close to Termini is great + Rooms very quiet for being so central + Nice, clean, almost brand new and superb rooms = You don't need any other hotel when in Rome! Next time I will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the train station, and good value, but in need of a tourist desk!”
Reviews.Author: Avataarkaap
Reviews.Content: We ended our romantic holiday in Rome, and decided to take a chance on UNA as it was close to the station. Overall, I was happy, but there were a couple things that bugged me. Firstly, the aircon that didn't work because it was not yet Summer was a little ridiculous. It was super hot, and I couldn't sleep very well. Mercifully it was turned on, somewhat, the next night, as I think enough people must have complained. The other thing was that there was no separate concierge desk, so there were always queues at the reception, and for one of the biggest tourist cities in the world, this hotel was not equipped to help the hordes of tourists. When I asked the gentleman at reception if he could help me book for certain attractions (Vatican and Colosseum), he told me to look online and book it myself. I feel like they are missing a trick as I would have paid for some help with bookings and recommendations. Breakfast was fab, as was room service and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well appointed. Excellent location for Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ian190950
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming and efficient reception staff. Comfortable and well appointed room with contemporary furnishing. Restaurant staff efficient and very attentive and meals were reasonably priced. We ate here 2 out of 3 nights. Our only foray for an evening meal outside was disappointing. Minor issues; Roof terrace was closed. Bathroom ceiling showed water staining and could do with a repaint. Handy for transport if you want it, and centrally located for walking around the sights. If I was to return to Rome, I'd book the Hotel Una without hestitation

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MesutBalta
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rome for 1 week due to working purpose. I had my boss in Istanbul booking this great hotel for me and it was great. The hotel is very clean and modern. great and helpful staff. During the night I had a respiratory problem because I ate something I am allergic, and the staff called me a doctor. All went perfect. I loved my room I had great view to Rome. This hotel is also very near most monuments in center town.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time looking any further....book this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TheRealTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from March 31- April 3 2011. We arrived at the hotel early about 9am and our room was not ready, but we expected this. The hotel kept our luggage for us and we walked around the corner and toured the Basilica Maggiore. When we returned at about 10:30 our room was available. We stayed in a Superior room which had the tub/shower. The pictures online are accurate and the room size was adequate. The hotel was very clean. The bed was comfortable and you can request a feather pillow if needed. If you need to iron....bring one. The hotel staff, and especially the ones at the registration desk were extremely professional and pleasant. The hotel is close to everything. Now, for the tips...book your Vatican/St. Peter's tour with Presto Tours. Our tour guides name was Ryan and all I can say is Wow! He was great and extremely knowledgeable. Copy and paste the link to view his video. The tour was 108 euro for two and worth every euro. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g9S6941FMzU For FCO airport transportation to/from the hotel we use Rome Limo Rental. 50 euro each way. I made the reservation online and was sent an email with confirmatin within hours. The driver was waiting at the airport and waiting at the hotel for our return trip back to the airport. No problems at all. http://romelimorental.com/airport_transfer.html We found a great spot for lunch not far from the Trevi Fountain, Agrodolce on Via dei Crociferi, 25...

Reviews.Title: “QUALITY HOTEL WITH EXCELLENT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: denisehowells66
Reviews.Content: THE Una RomaHotel is central for the main train/bus terminal,it is within walking distance along the ViaCavour,Nazionale and the Via Del Quirinale to the COLOSSEUM,TREVI FOUNTAIN ,PANTHEON,SPANISH STEPS AND THE VATICAN.The Una is a modern well managed hotel with excellent staff and quality rooms.Breakfast was an extensive range of cereals,danish pastries,croissants,bacon.eggs,sausage and coffee.Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “My feedback form said "don't change a thing"!”
Reviews.Author: MikeyJohn
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a gem, very different from other claimed 4 star hotels in the city. It is clean, modern, spacious, efficient, centrally located, offers excellent facilities (including a wonderful fine dining restaurant)...and yes good value for money (note it is not cheap, but the quality is excellent, hence it represents good value).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great service, great quality”
Reviews.Author: Tina191255
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights (21/3/11 - 233/11) - great location, really lovely rooms, free buffet breakfast, upgraded to superior room on check in which was nice. Could not fault the hotel or the service. Go to the nearby Termini station pay 42 euros for hop on hop off bus which included 'beat the queue' at the Vatican - well worth it. Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum etc all within 10 - 20 minute walking distance, bus ride to the Vatican, they stop regularly. Had evening meal in hotel on one night with 15% discount voucher each, so that helped the cost of the bill, would definitely stay there again, clean, comfortable, rooms, had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: SuePete
Reviews.Content: From the extensive breakfast buffet, to the ultra-modern lighting/keylock systems, to the service of the staff, this hotel, located two minutes' walk from the train terminal, is a traveler's oasis. Got a great deal on Expedia - decided to stay in Rome a few extra days on our own after taking an escorted tour of Italy. The hotel Palatino (the hotel used by the tour company) was OK, but UNA was twice the hotel at half the price, so I'm very glad we made the switch. Plus, the location can't be beat for doing your own travel - hop-on-off bus is nearby and we took a trip to Orvieto on our own - nice to be so close to the train.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChampagneTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: This new modern hotel was very nice. The room very clean and had a comfortable king sized bed. The bathroom had a large shower/tub and modern sink. The room was very quiet for a Roman hotel. Great inclusive breakfast buffet. The location is very close to the train station. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and fancy”
Reviews.Author: bridmac26
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent, they do not have tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms but my aunt asked could she have it and they brought one up no problem. The room wasn't very big but we werent in it that much so was fine. The bathroom was lovely. The heating in the room was very high and was hard to work. The location was excellent, Termini station was right around the corner and the metro system was great. You can also walk everywhere here, we walked to Trevi Fountain, which on the map was at the opposite end but only took 25 minutes but was nice weather. The breakfast was excellent, buffet style with a wide variety. The restaurant also served food but it was expensive. This hotel was expensive but we got a good deal on a comparison website and that is why we chose it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Grimman
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hote, nice breakfast. Will return for next stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Vallettka
Reviews.Content: The position of the hotel is simply brilliant. Only one block away from Termini yet spared all the noise and crowds normally associated with Train Stations. I stayed there for 3 days in February and was very happy with the services that the hotel offers. During breakfast the service was brisk and efficient. The choice of pastries and cakes offered is amazing and the trays with cheeses and meats are replenished constantly. i particularly liked the offer of cappuccino instead of boring coffee with milk. Rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean. I did not like the idea of having to pay for internet connection in the hotel. If I wanted to have connection for 3 days of my stay I would need to fork out €75. Needless to say I feel that in a hotel which claims to attract business clients this is outrage. The management should correct this issue. Other than that I absolutely enjoyed my stay in Una

Reviews.Title: “COULD DO BETTER”
Reviews.Author: gwr8
Reviews.Content: Booked two double rooms for a three night break with friends.Requested two non smoking rooms and one of them had a ash tray in.Both Rooms were superior. No tea/coffee making facilities in these rooms and considering the price we were very disapointed. I requested a tea tray but this could not be provided. Rooms were very hot and stuffy. No information in rooms regarding tv or in fact any thing !. Beds huge and comfy and nice complimentary toilitries. Priced for room service and in restaurant very high. Staff not very efficent or friendly. Breakfast staff failed to clear your table and very sloww with tea/coffee. Large selection of items for breakfast but hot items very poor especially the egg. You also have to pay an extra tax on checking out of 3 euros per person per night. This hotel was not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, massive bed”
Reviews.Author: evanstar20
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, was gorgeous! The bed was very comfy and easy to get lost in, room keep very clean and bathroom big with a bath/shower and bd included! Room service food way over priced and portions very small, but breakfast in the morning is very nice and lots of choice. (dont order the hot choc, its more like choc mud you cant drink it) Staff very polite and helpful, hotel right next to termini station very easy to find. Would defo visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, contemporate hotel with some minuses”
Reviews.Author: Syltan
Reviews.Content: After all raving reviews on Tripadvisor I was glad too see for myself that UNA hotel is indeed a pretty new and nice, comfortable and clean contemporate hotel. It is located close to Termini and just like many areas around central stations around the world the area is a bit dodgy with lots of tourist trap restaurants all around. It is conveniently located for taking any sort of transportation though. The room we had was relatively roomy for a big city standard hotel room; we could walk around the bed and plenty of space for our belongings. Also the room was very, very clean and shiny including the bathroom. Service at the reception and during breakfast was very attentive and nice. Some downsides were that the room was very, very hot, even in February. Perhaps the airco does actually work during the warmer months? I didn't bother to check cause the window could be opened. For some this might be another downside though as it gets pretty noisy outside, but it's mainly traffic noise, so rather lulling in my opinion. Another minus was the fact that the speaker in the bathroom with the sound from the TV could not be switched off and that the volume in the bathroom remained loud despite having it turned to silent as much as possible. The bass tones kept droning through the wall when watching TV. Also the selection of internation channels was rather disappointing and it took a while to figure out where they were hidden on the remote as there was no booklet with information on how and what. Internet use was not free, so a simple thing like checking in for your return flight will cost at least 3 euro as that's the start tariff and the reception has to go through a whole ordeal of creating a personal account for you. All in all though a good and affordable hotel which I would recommend and consider staying at again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and nice service. Cuisine is not impressive at all.”
Reviews.Author: SNGV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few nights. Was generally satisfied with everything except for food quality. I had a fairly spacious room (as I understand most of the rooms are less spacious, but I got lucky). The place is very clean, with very nice design. You don't get disturbed by the chambermaids. Their conference facility is fairly spacious as well. They don't allow any drinks (except for water) in the conference room though. This is rather unusual. The Restaurant: Pastas and deserts are fairly good! Main courses are tasteless and disappointing. Breakfast was also a disappointment for me. If you are into pastry in the morning then this hotel is the perfect place for you! They offer a generous variety of pastry (pies, croissants etc.) Apart from that, there is a choice of: omlet, boiled eggs, bacon and sausages, some cold cuts of supermarket quality. The good part was an assortment of fruit and yoghurt. I expected much better from a hotel of this type.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but certainly no luxury accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Missriana
Reviews.Content: UNA was very clean and sleek, with modern, beautiful furnishings and an excellent location. Our TV broke, and the entire week we were there it wasn't fixed. In addition, the paid internet and lack of any sort of extra furnishing other than a chair and a telephone was a little bit annoying. The service was friendly, if not a bit lost, as nobody at the front desk was able to explain how to use the phone for local calls. It's in a nice part of the city, with fantastic restaurants literally all around it. Rome is unbelievable, so we spent most of our time out of the hotel. It was definitely a nice, comfortable place to come back to at night though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel close to Termini Rail station”
Reviews.Author: TracyLT
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely clean hotel with well appointed rooms. It is close to Termini rail station (1 min across the road from it) and that is one reason why we chose it. I had read reviews on Trip Advisor about the safety issues near the rail station but we didnt experience any trouble. We were there on New Years Eve and there were loud, drunk people about but you get that in any place on New Years. Breakfast is sensational with huge amounts to choose from and the hot chocolate was the best we had in all of Italy!! We walked to most areas from the hotel (15min to Colloseum etc). Our luggage was lost/delayed by British Airways and the hotel staff were very helpful with suggesting places to buy clothing/toiletries etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mgtmog
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Una is beside the main rail station in Rome. The hotel is clean and newly opened. The rooms were not huge but they were very comfortable with lovely bathrooms. The location was great for getting to airport (FCO) and also for sightseeing. The buffet breakfast was great and the hotel had a buzzy atmosphere. The drinks at the bar wer very very expensive so we avoided that. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location- SOOO convenient”
Reviews.Author: aduf
Reviews.Content: When I was researching our trip to Rome, I wanted to pick a hotel that was both nice and really convenient to all the sites. The Una was both. We took the train from Fiumicino Airport and when we arrived, the hotel was less than a 10 minute walk (the train from the airport arrives on a track on the opposite end of the train station). We were immediately given our room (arrived around 2pm) and were really happen with it. The room and the bathroom was really nice (a great rainhead shower). Nice toiletries, spacious wardrobes, comfortable beds. The room we stayed in was really quite and the blackout shades were amazing (we overslept they were so great!). The buffet breakfast was wonderful- the selection is great. Can't say enough about the location. Both metro lines stop at the train station (Termini) and even if you want to walk to all the sites, they are all within walking distance. We did a lot of both (we used Rick Steve's guide book and highly recommend it- some really great walking tours and invaluable sightseeing tips). A few of the reviews I read while i was researching the trip mentioned feeling unsafe in the neighborhood around the train station, I never felt unsafe and like any big city, it is always wise to be aware of your surroundings and be cautious. The staff were friendly and happy to help with directions. I would highly recommend this hotel (already have)....an overall wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: rosicamc
Reviews.Content: is for the second time staying at a hotel from UNA network, after the one in Brescia few years ago . I try to understand what happened to people who were not satisfied with this hotel. the staff was helpful every time I had a question and all the people from the staff with wich I had spoken was polite. Room was great: large enough, well organized, very large bathroom and everything was very clean. breakfast is abundant, fresh food,the juice is made from fresh fruits. staff who work in the morning for breakfast is fantastic, polite and is working fast and efficient. Indeed the Internet is expensive but we did not need it and therefore was not a bad thing for us. As a negative thing, I can say that in the bathroom was not hot enough. the Termini station are is not the most beautiful in Rome but we felt safe every time. I recommend this hotel to all people who want to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel in an Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gtsamd
Reviews.Content: Our family highly recommends this hotel. - Excellent location: literally across the street from the train station - Very modern and clean rooms - Excellent breakfast selection and efficient staff even though it could get very, very busy in the morning - Knowledgeable and helpful front desk staff, e.g., when asked for a restaurant recommendation on our last day, we were directed to 'Alfredo's' --> little did we know that this is from the famed 'Fettucine Alfredo' fame!, gave us bus directions accurately, etc. - Forgot to put my 2 kids in the reservation, but they were still kind enough to upgrade the room!! so we were pretty happy with that... - They have some promo rates with internet so try to get that as i had to pay extra for wifi

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RG0482
Reviews.Content: Well located, nearby Termini central station, where we can easily have access to and from airport, trains, express buses to Rome main tourist venues and walk down the avenue towards coloseo. The rooms were very confortable and had high quality amenities. The breakfast was excellent and well managed, as there were many people in the room. The only con was the internet, which was paid. Anyway, we had a very nice experience in Una Roma and recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravelReviewer_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in September 2010. Excellent location - it seems the immediate area around Termini has been cleaned up quiet a bit and my partner and I felt safe enough to walk after dark, especially after eating at restaurants nearby. It's within walking distance to just about every main tourist attraction in Rome (we love to walk!). The quality and cleanliness of the rooms is perfect and the staff are very friendly. A large variety of food is served at breakfast. The only disappointments were that the pastries served at breakfast always tasted stale and wireless internet connection is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsHedgehog
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to Rome for our wedding anniversary and my birthday. He had booked this hotel and I was more than impressed with his choice. From the moment we walked through the front door we were treated extremely well by courteous and friendly staff. The staff on the front desk were very friendly and apologetic when they were unable to get the door key correctly programmed so we were escorted up to our room by the bell hop who promised to bring the keycard to the room once it was programmed( we collected it ourselves!! We had a good night's sleep and breakfast the next morning was awesome loads of choice and they even had soya milk. We spent the day at the Vatican which was easily reached on the Metro. ( There are only 2 lines so not too complicated) Sadly it was pouring with rain and the queue at the entrance to The Vatican Museum snaked it's way round 2 sides of the city walls. Mainly because of the rain we bite the bullet and paid 40 euros each to jump the queue and have a guided tour. Well worth it as the guide was really informative and even in the Sistine Chapel when silence is the order of the day she managed to talk quietly enough to explain about all the paintings and the significance of different parts of the most famous wall possibly in the world. We also went into St Peter's Basilica and of course the square. Back at the hotel (very wet and footsore) there was an envelope waiting for me in the room with a typed note wishing me a Happy Birthday( the numerous cards were a clue) and a voucher for 2 free drinks in the bar. Nice touch!! We ate in the restaurant and found a set menu which was very nice included bread , water and a glass of wine for 35 euros each. When the bill came there was a discount as we were staying the hotel so a 5 course meal cost less than pizza and pasta that we had eaten the previous night. On our final day we were able to checkout and then leave our bags in a locked room until we collected them before catching the train back to the airport. (costs 14 euros each from the airport but 15 each on the way back!) The train left from platform 28 which took about 10 minutes to walk to so leave plenty of time before the departure time . All in all a brilliant weekend and i would recommend the hotel as a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: amckOxford
Reviews.Content: I sayed at the Una hotel on business and had a mixed experience. On the plus side, the room was spacious and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was large with a big walk-in shower (no bath) and a big, illuminated mirror. There are plugs for hairdryer etc in the bathroom. On the down side, no conditioner, just shampoo, aircon that turns itself back on after you turn it off (very noisy fan), patchy phone signal (I found the best spot to be outside the gents loos in the foyer, nothing in my room), chargeable internet access (daylight robbery) and room service breakfast that didn't arrive. The situation is very close to the railway station indeed, and you have to walk along some narrrow, grubby streets to get to the shopping area. There are no decent bars close by and it's quite a walk to get a decent coffee. No coffee facilities in the room, no iron, stupidly expensive mini bar (3.50 euro for a small bottle of water). I wouldn't choose to stay here again, the phone signal issue is just too irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & smart hotel in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: mikeb1969
Reviews.Content: The Una is located a couple of minutes walk from the Termini rail station, easy to find & in not too bad an area. The hotel is modern, clean and the staff are polite. We stayed in a standard room which was slightly small, but still very clean & had a good size & compfy bed. The breakfast buffet offered a wide choice of food and filled us up for a day of sightseeing. The metro line is under the rail station & the bus depot is outside so very handy for getting around easily. i.e. you can get anywhere within 15 minutes or so.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean & Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: CAD3876
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at several UNA hotels during our trip to Italy. Pros: It is newer, so it is very clean. The Bathrooms are HUGE and have fabulous soaking tubs. The bedrooms are goreous with wood floors, nice whie linens and several beautiful windows. There is a safe and a mini-fridge which are nice to have, and our room (standard Queen room) even had a foyer. The area is great - we literally walked to everything (except the Vatican - take the subway for that), however if you aren't a walker the easy to use subway is about 2 blocks away. We took the train in from Florence and walked 2 blocks to the hotel - super convenient! Cons: Of all of our stays in Italy, the Rome staff was the most abrupt. They're not rude - they just aren't super friendly. The hotel is rather large and some days we had to wait for breakfast. There is a market at the train station which we found useful to buy water and other snacks. While the area is convenient, just be careful if you head towards the train station...it is a little sketchy there (people standing around, dirty shops, etc.) but do not let that sway you from staying here. It is close to everything and there is so much to see. At the end of the day it is so nice to go back to this clean, new, hotel. We would definitely stay here again! You must see the Sistine Chapel, the Catacombs are well worth it, great shopping all around the Spanish Steps, Great food around the Pantheon's charming streets.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Modern Hotel, Just OK Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Powers17
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd and last hotel we stayed in during out 1 week Italy vacation. One block from the central train station if you need to be near trains. About 15-20 min walk to the Colosseum but other main sights are not that close to walk (but the Metro is right there so that's convenient). The hotel is definitely modern, new, trendy. But the rooms were tiny (even for Europe) - everything in the room was placed for function, with no extra space to move around. The bathroom sink was just that - no counter space at all and we had to place our toiletries on the floor! After staying at 2 other hotels where the customer service was fantastic, I felt that this one was lacking. Had more of a corporate feel then a homey, warm feel. The front desk was helpful in the sense that they answered your questions but they did not go above and beyond. When we arrived, there was no one around to help us with our luggage, we had to carry it ourselves. Also, they charge a lot of $ for internet usage but there are 2 cheap internet cafes next door. Breakfast was good though

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice when visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: bikiniamber
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location just across the road from the station, so easy access from the airport using the train link. Close to shops and there are plenty of restaurants around (although they're of mixed quality) and Rome is small enough that you can walk almost anywhere. Nice clean, modern decor throughout hotel. Good bar (with nice touch of snacks served at happy hour). Breakfast was fine - good, airy room, nice pastries and all the basics but not loads of choice. Rooms are small but modern and very functional - large, comfy bed, good shower and very quiet. Only issue I had was that the air conditioning didn't seem to work properly at night and it was too hot. Overall, I would definitely recommend. Its a well located, modern hotel at a decent price in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice contemporary hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cadmapper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly new and is clean and modern. The location is only two blocks from Stazione Termini, the main Rome train station. It is also within walking distance of Santa Maria Maggiore, and less then a mile from the Colosseum. I have read reviews of other hotels in the area being somewhat dated and worn, but this one is just the opposite. It isn't as grand as the Excelsior or the St. Regis, but it is comfortable, stylish, and well situated.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect (except the scrambled eggs)”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn_GNL
Reviews.Content: I can't believe anybody has given this hotel less than top ratings. We were there for 3 days last week, and had a wonderful time. The staff were very courteous, helpful, and well informed (even when we arrived early, and were late for our check-out). The whole hotel is clean, modern and beautifully designed, the beds are very comfortable, the location ideal (for walking, taxi, bus, metro, or train), and the breakfast buffet was extensive (really didn't like the scrambled eggs though). We are well traveled, and quite discerning, but found this hotel completely to our liking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, quality & service. Convienient location.”
Reviews.Author: Bobbyandden
Reviews.Content: Easy to walk to from the main train station in Rome which also makes it very easy to get back to after spending all day sight seeing as many of the buses and metro trains go to the Termini (main station). The reception staff were very professional, efficient and helpful. When I was checking in the receptionist provided us with a clear street map and highlighted where to visit and how best to get there which was a great help. I asked for a quiet room and was put on the sixth floor in a room facing the inside and we heard nothing during our stay. The room was much larger than expected and very luxurious with a huge bed (two singles connected) TV, big bath etc... The breakfast was really good, with a very large selection, (cereals, fruits, yoghurt, cheese and salami, fresh rolls, pastries, cakes, juices, bacon, sausages and very yellow scrambled egg). The coffee was great and the staff very polite and efficient. The location of the hotel was great. We paid €25 each for a Roma Pass which gave us unlimited public transport, free entry to two museums (Colosseum and Roman Forum included) and then reduced prices to other attractions for three days. So we just hopped on the metro or buses to get around. I would recommend wearing comfortable shoes as there is so much walking. Another advantage of the Roma Pass was that you skipped pass the huge cues at the attractions, especially the Colosseum. We were recommended a local restaurant by the receptionist which was really great and just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Polite complaining works wonders”
Reviews.Author: Neal2277
Reviews.Content: Booked with Una corporate to stay in three of their properties (Florence, Rome, Venice) while touring Italy with my wife and 18 year old son. Got a nice discount. However when I checked in at the Rome property I was given a very small room which with my son's roll away bed was simply impossible. Returned to the desk and was told nothing could be done went back to the room and tried to rearrange the furniture and it was still not going to work. Returned to front desk and told the rather cold and abrupt clerk that the room was unacceptable period--I was a corporate reservation and requested to speak to the manager on duty. This lady didn't speak English but took one look at the reservation and directed the supercilious desk clerk to put us in a nice two room suite which was great! Thank you very much. The biggest issue most people will have with the hotel is the location--about two blocks from the train station. Not a high rent neighborhood. In fact I watched a homeless guy sit in a doorway across the street for three days and nights. At the historic baths a few blocks away I saw the mobile health service van giving the homeless Heroin addicts their "treatments". However, I never felt uncomfortable walking the local streets even after dark and there are some reasonable eateries just around the corner. Being installed in a suite probably skews my review...there was some street noise at night and there is full time security personnel in the lobby to keep out the riff raff but I found it comfortable and convenient with a nice free breakfast. My wife didn't care for the location but even she felt the room was nice--especially with the three of us in it. I'd stay again--she says I should find a better located B&B sort of place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: granger-mark
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Rome quite late after taking the Leonardo Express from the airport, then found ourselves walking through an unsavoury neighbourhood in our search for the hotel. In hindsight this was completely unnecessary and could have been avoided had we taken a longer walk along the platform to the main station exit (by the bus station) then crossed over the road to Via Cavour to take the first left to the hotel. Once we found our bearings on the second day, the area between the hotel and main routes out was relatively safe and we did not feel threatened at all. The location is perfect as others have said, Rome attractions are easily accessible on foot and this hotel is an ideal base from which to explore. The close proximity to the metro is also a convenient for the blue line (Colosseum) and red line (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Vatican). The hotel is clean and modern and we were very impressed with both the quality of service and the facilities. Our check-in experience was pleasant and the reception staff provided maps and helpful tips on how to get about, the bar staff were very friendly and if you visit early in the evening there is a free buffet to enjoy with your drinks before you head out for your evening meal. Breakfast was good by European standards with a lot to choose from with tea and/or excellent coffee provided when you are shown to your table. I agree that it does get busy between 9 and 10, but the queue is generally short and you are not kept waiting for long. The scrambled eggs were an interesting colour but they tasted fine. Our room was big and our queen size bed massive, the bathroom was also well appointed and the shower was powerful and kept a constant water temperature.. Overall I cannot fault the hotel, it was ideal for our needs, reasonably priced and in a great location. We choose this hotel based on the many positive reviews, I was almost put off by comments about surrounding area but as long as you don’t stray too far off the beaten track this is not an issue. I would certainly recommend UNA Roma to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMD22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. The location is perfect, as others have said. The rooms were clean and modern, and I found the staff very polite and helpful. The wifi and mini bar deal was really worth it. I loved everything about this hotel. It made my stay in Rome completely comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: markopoulou04
Reviews.Content: being next to both metro and bus station makes it really convenient to get around the city. my husband and I loved the room and bathroom furniture as well as the cleanliness the hotel provides .breakfast was also great with a wide variety of food,including even biological products while the staff serving breakfast was friendly and helpful .i strongly recommend this hotel because it certainly offers good value and QUALITY for money! maria&dimitris from Greece

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: chicomcchappy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the UNA for 4 nights in Oct 2010. we had a very stylish room with a huge bed, modern furniture. Nice big bathroom with good toiletries. Reception staff were very efficient, pleasant and helpful. We had a room on 5th floor over the main enterance and had no issues with noise from outside. The hotel is beside the Termini, on the first 2 days we walked everywhere, 15 mins to colleseum, anout 25 to trevi fountain, 5 more to Pantheon, and 5 more to piazzza Navona. The last 2 days we used the Metro to get round, station right beside the hotel, vatican 6 stops away, 10 mins. colleseum, trevi, pantheon, spanish steps, etc all only 5 mins on metro. The breakfast in the hotel is great, huge selection and the staff are very helpful. I would stay here again in a flash, great hotel. we loved it

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cheshire_Cat_2009
Reviews.Content: Choose UNA Hotel upon recommendation and rating on Tripadvisor, and was not disappointed! The location is perfect, close to Termini station (Metro and train) and ideal for street cafes, trattorias etc. The only slight downside is that it is on the edge of a not so nice area, but I didn't feel threatened nor put off. Received a warm, welcome reception, and tips on the best way to travel. Our room was clean and tidy (stayed in a classic room). Bed very comfortable...asked for extra pillows, they were on our bed when we returned that night. Breakfast was served at a decent time...and for you sleepy heads... until 10.30am, plenty to choose from and service was first class. We didn't eat in the hotel on an evening, too expensive, instead went to local restaurants around the corner, eat outside and watched the world go back. Be warned: you get pestered by people trying to sell tacky gifts and the lucky lucky watch man. Be firm and say no! They eventually get the message. This is my first trip to Rome and my partner's third time, and even he said the location and hotel was just perfect. We were happy with our choice and were sad to leave after 3 days. The whole experience of Rome and its history was breathtaking.... my little flippers (feet) took a bit of a battering with the many miles!! I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip to Rome worthwhile!”
Reviews.Author: UnderCeej
Reviews.Content: My partner's family are Italian. Being so, when we visited the family home this Summer, my partner booked 2 days away to Rome mid-week so that I could see the sights. She primarily booked the hotel Una because of its locality, literally across the street and around the corner from Romes' Termini. When we got there, tired from a 3hr train journey in the morning heat, the fact the hotel WAS so close was a godsend! When we checked in, there were 4 very smartly dressed concierce staff literally waiting to check us in, even though the reception area was busy with people coming and going. The lady who checked us in in perfect English also told us we were actually getting a room upgrade, much to the delight of ourselves! When being ushered to our room (from a standard double to a superior double), we could not find any fault with the cleanliness of the place. The room was very comfy, with lots of space everywhere for bits and pieces, a lovely TV which did pick up more than 7 English-speaking channels, an easy to use safe and minibar, and a gorgeous spotless bathroom. The windows in the room also opened out fully onto a metal railing so you could have them open while in the room and not worry about anything coming in. The beds were immaculate and extremely comfy (so comfy, we almost slept in on the 1st day!) and the breakfasts were really tasty with so much choice, despite being a "buffet". (When you check in for breakfast, the waiter or waitress who serves you brings you unlimited hot drinks of your choice and you can visit the breakfast bar however many times you choose. Even if you're not a buffet person, you'll find yourself going back to sample all the different types of food!) Being in Rome, we found we didn't use the restaurant in the hotel but if we had of opted for a meal, we're absolutely sure we wouldn't've been disappointed! So, to summise, if you book a hotel here for your wife/girlfriend as a surprise, rest assured it'll be the best booking you make!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMacklin10
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of looking for a hotel to stay in after the conclusion of our Italy group tour. I used Trip Advisor and Hotels.com to read review, and also checked out UNA's website. The price and location couldn't be beat, so I went ahead and made a reservation. You never really know about a place until you get there. Once we made it back to Rome, the hotel was conveniently located just two blocks from the main station (Termini). The outside wasn't assuming or anything, but when you walked in, it was a great looking place. Made it up to our room and we couldn't have been more pleased. The place looks virtually new; the bed, unlike many places in Italy, was a nice queen to kingish size. The bathroom was modern, as was the inclusion of a flat screen tv. And the best addition, an amazing continental breakfast - we aren't talking about just toast and coffee, but all sorts of Italian breakfast treats, juices, cereals, breads, cheeses, etc. We were sad we had to leave super early after our third day, as we wouldn't be able to enjoy the breakfast. My only hang up is I wish, since they do get satelitte/cable, that they'd subscribe to more channels for English speaking travelers (Americans, Canadiens, Australians, etc.). I'd definitely recommend staying here and if I am ever in Italy again, I will look to stay at one of the many UNA Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculately clean & beautifully styled, very close to bus & rail station but photos had shown a roof terrace.”
Reviews.Author: retiredhols
Reviews.Content: A very stylish room with a huge bed, modern furniture and fittings. Toiletries supplied were all vegetable based thus avoiding any allergies. Room was spotless! Only problem was that it was difficult to get into such a deep bath to use the shower as ther was no handrail and the showerscreen was in the way. Reception staff were very efficient, pleasant and helpful. Arrived early but were very pleasantly surprised to be allowed into our room. We were lucky to have a room overlooking the inner courtyard but I do think there could have been some noise from trams if we had a room on outer edge of hotel. Convenient location near bus and train stations and had no trouble walking to our hotel on arrival. Disappointed to find that there was no outdoor space even although photos had shown sunloungers on a roof terrace.Lots of tourist restaurants in area but take care as some were poor quality or overpriced. Check menu before ordering even a drink! Main roads into city centre close but traffic horrendous! I've never experienced zebra crossings like this before. Had great holiday,7 days, feet sore,pockets empty but enjoyed it thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Merbee
