Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights - this is one of the best city hotels we have stayed in. The staff here are friendly and happy. Rooms are ultra modern. Flat screen TV, Giant comfy bed, Huge bath....and spotlessly clean. The location is ideal for seeing all the sights. A minutes walk to the Termini where you can catch the Metro to all the major sights. We walked to most places, 20 mins to the Colloseum and we even walked all the way to Vatican City! The breakfast was great. There is a wide choice. Cereals, pastries, toast with jams, fruit. etc etc If you are looking for a hotel in Rome that is in a good location with great services, then look no further, this place is the one!!

Reviews.Title: “Most modern hotel in Roma”
Reviews.Author: 5starUk
Reviews.Content: Following a recommendation, my Mother & I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is beautiful, well maintained and everywhere was very clean. The front-of-house staff were always friendly and professional, providing us with a map on arrival pointing out the best places to see, eat and bus/tube routes etc. We stayed in a superior room on the corner of the hotel. The rooms are smart, modern and well-appointed. Pillow menu, plasma TV, mini-bar, electronic safe, slippers etc. Unfortunately they could not provide us with twin beds but we were given a king-size bed and a gorgeous bathroom with a deep-soak bath. The water was never hot but was always warm enough. There is noise from the trams and train station but it didn't bother us too much. Breakfast was superb to set you up for a day sightseeing, plenty of choice with tea and coffee served to your table. We had to queue one morning for a table but the host was superb and we had a table in less than 5 minutes. The only downside was the area. Yes, it was close to the Termini, but, as mentionned by previous reviewers, the area was grim & creepy to say the least. Two women walking alone did not feel particulaly safe. However, it was well lit at night and there was always plenty of people walking around. To be fair it was only the streets between the hotel & the Termini, the streets behind seemed nice enough. Overall, a beautiful, comfortable hotel to return to at the end of a long day of sightseeing in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy place”
Reviews.Author: Bondit
Reviews.Content: Not the best, in UNA chain. Tram under windows very noisy. Staff is rude.... In general is ok, but might be better. accourding expectations

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hiroko.holloway
Reviews.Content: I stayed two night at this hotel but this hotel was really amazing. especially I liked their breakfast. there werent hot stuff but its totally enough. Ham,cheese, delisious bread, cookies, it was so good. I defenitely chose this hotel, if i go bak to rome again. breakfast, so good.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy decor”
Reviews.Author: AlyBV
Reviews.Content: We booked here because many of our first choices were full probably due to the U2 concert we attended that weekend. After reading a few reviews prior to October we were really worried about our choice till we wound up experiencing it ourselves. It shows you how a few reviews could really ruin a place, but I chose to write this because with the exception of that one very unlucky couple who had floods and pushed together twin beds we found it hard to believe things were that bad after our stay proved otherwise. The men and women at the front desk were lovely and helpful on the three occasions we used them (three different individuals) and of course a city map was offered along with an overview of some major destinations upon check in. The breakfast was a great full breakfast, coffee and cappuccinos came within 2 minutes after the order. The hostess was welcoming and the waiters were always nearby. Mostly, except for coffee you don't need them anyway. While there were some canned fruits (peaches) and the juices were a pass there was plenty of fresh fruit available and the breads were outstanding and freshly baked. The rooms and decor are extremely high end; the high gloss lacquered wood furniture and appointments were tasteful and the look was really modern and comfortable. The bathroom was exceptional and had a spotless glass shower door and a deep soaking tub. I didn't have any trouble with the water temperature The mattresses are European hotel-style mattresses - which are definitely harder than American high end hotel mattresses but these were better than many I've experienced in Europe (in one excellent high-end hotel I recently stayed at in Prague I just put an extra downy blanket over the mattress and it was just fine, here it wasn't necessary). In all, many locations in Rome have a creepy look after dark.. but this is my second visit to this city in a year and I've been out late nearly every night and have felt fine about walking around. Granted its near a major bus/train station (think NY's Port Authority) but his hotel and the neighborhood was well lit even when we arrived past 1 am. There are several other high end large hotels within blocks. Last year we stayed at Hotel Ponte Sisto (just across a walking bridge from Trastevere) which was more centrally located to the 'touristy' areas but the neighborhood at night reminded me of NY's East Village 20 years ago (gritty). While it was a really lovely boutique-style hotel, it was in a neighborhood that would freak people out if they aren't accustomed to this type of unrefined 'grittiness'- these locations aren't for everyone but then, they are the one's who'd be missing out on some cool hotels. My biggest complaint: a hotel trying to appeal to business travelers and cool-trendy people MUST HAVE FREE WIFI...The UNA hotel chain needs to get into this millennium and offer it. For these rates there's simply no excuse. Period.

Reviews.Title: “Modern gem in Rome..”
Reviews.Author: JandSLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Una Roma for two nights in early October 2010. Having done our research, it seemed most of the hotels in Rome were old/traditional in style and as my husband & I prefer modern hotels, this place was ideal. Only opened last November, the hotel is modern, clean and crisp in style. The rooms are small but spotlessly clean, modern bathroom and the usual expected facilities. We were originally put in a tiny room with two twin beds pushed together but we asked to be moved to a double room (which was probably about a foot bigger) and the hotel staff were happy to move us. Location was OK - literally 2 mins walk from Termini (so convenient if taking the Leonardo Express from FCO airport, about 15 mins (slow) walk to the Colosseum but a little bit further to the other sights. Not horrendously far but it seemed that way at the end of a long day of sightseeing! I was concerned about the level of help/service we'd get from the hotel staff after reading reviews here but was pleasantly surprised. Maybe those who got a cold welcome arrived on a bad day! Breakfast was the same for the two days we were there - would have got tired of it by the third day! Most of the breakfast was tailored to a sweet tooth (pastries, tarts, lots of Nutella!) but there was also a selection of breads. The scrambled eggs looked radioactive though! All in all, a very pleasant stay at the Una Roma. If I return to Italy, I will definitely look up their hotels in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Modern Hotel in Historic Rome”
Reviews.Author: Natla
Reviews.Content: Arrived at UNA hotel at 11am with the intention of leaving our bags after catching a very early flight. To our great surprise our hotel room was ready to check in to and the hotel was giving us a complimentary upgrade to a superior room with a massive super king size bed (rare for Europe) which was so comfortable. Una is a modern, clean and contemporary hotel which for me made a nice contrast to the historic city of Rome. The Terminal area of Rome is very busy and noisy with trains, buses and trams. Picked this area for it good transport links to the airport (€8 return via coach) and waking distance to the coliseum. The hotel has done its best to sound proof its rooms but there was still a slight dulling noise of traffic in the bathroom. This didn't bother us though as the room, breakfast and price more than made up for this in a city which charges more for hotels than New York and Tokyo put together. Would seek to stay in a UNA hotel again when visiting Italy.

Reviews.Title: “terrific”
Reviews.Author: ADOL66
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean roomsand nice personal, tasteful breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel at good price and convenient location..”
Reviews.Author: Ling101028
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6. Despite staying there twice (5nights in total) during our holiday in Italy, hotel counter staff remained cold and impersonal. I must say most of its hardware were good, buffet breakfast was great, rooms were very good. .. but we honestly were not too impressed with its software (i.e. the people)..By the way, internet was at EUR6 per hour of access.. As it's near termini, sometimes the drunk can be noisy late at night..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Una - Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexandrasousa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real 4 stars. The location close to the train station and metro is not perfect but it's compensated by the price. Termini station is not a very pleasant place at night, but is not that bad as some reviews say. It's a area loaded with hotels and therefore, packed with tourists during dinner time. It's real close to everything by walking, which is a real good option taking in consideration that the traffic in Rome is chaotic even on the weekend! The hotel is new and very modern with a fantastic decoration. The room has a good area, with a good fashion furniture and the bathroom is also large. The blinders (black out) on the windows leave the room in complete darkness, which is very very rare go get. The bed is a 200x200 size with a medium hard mattress. Bed linen is good, done with two bed sheets, not very usual this days, and the bath towels are large in good quality. The breakfast has a good variety and is served until 10:30. The only small thing that the managment could improve is to clean some spots in the walls in the room, some uncarefully persons manage the luggage in a manner that it hits the wall. Small issue really easy to solve. Contacts: Via. Giovanni Amendola, 57, 00185-Roma, telf 003906649371, fax 003906649372, www.unahotels.it, una.roma@unahotels.it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business stay with great value for the room quality and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: cnchapman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Una Hotel in Rome for a week on a business trip with 2 colleagues. It was an excellent stay and definitely a very nice property for business travelers. I’ll describe the highlights along with the pros and cons as I see them for other travelers. First is the main “problem” that some reviews discuss: the location near Termini station. It is undoubtedly a mixed aspect of the hotel. On the positive side, it is only 1 block from the station, so it is a convenient location for trains, the Metro (it’s the only place where the current two lines cross), streetcars, and buses. It is also easy to get a cab from there because of the queue at the station. The station also has fast food, a large bookstore, and a variety of shops. If you take the Metro, you can get quickly to the Colosseum, the Spanish Steps, and the Vatican. On the negative side, there are few good restaurants nearby and it is not very convenient for the areas with the best restaurants and shops (Centro Storico and Trastevere areas). Then there is the question of personal safety. We did not feel threatened or otherwise in any danger, but the area to the South was clearly a “lower rent” area. If you walk towards the West and North (basically towards the central tourist areas), and either stay with others or don’t stay out too late, then you’ll probably feel no different than being in any other major city. In short, this seems like an overblown issue. A note on distance to the restaurant areas (e.g., near Spanish Steps and the Pantheon): you can walk there in 30-40 minutes from the Una, if you are a reasonably in shape walker. Expect some minor slopes on the way back and to get hot and sweaty, but overall a pleasant and reasonable walk for people who like to walk. Now, for the hotel itself: it was great! I stayed in a “superior room” with terrace, and it was larger than I expected and exceptionally clean. I mean really, really, exceptionally clean. The hotel is new and very modern and the furnishings were not only high quality but immaculately kept. The bathroom was large and would be very comfortable for two people (with the exception that the shower in my room was a combo shower/tub that would only serve 1 at a time). The terrace was pleasant and roomy with a small table and chairs; no particular view but nice for a fresh air break. The bed was comfortable enough: not too hard, not too soft, with plenty of room all around and several pillows and a nice (and clean and covered) comforter. An interesting feature was bedside controls for the room lighting. Housekeeping service was unobtrusive and seemed to be very efficient, attending to the room promptly when I was out. One sign of both its value and cleanliness was that I observed several Japanese tour groups staying there (who were well-behaved and no reason for concern). In the room, the Air Conditioning worked very well – it was able to keep the room quite cool and dehumidified. I had feared that it might be the older European style system that provides little cooling, but it wasn’t. As some other reviews noted, the hot water did not get very hot. It was warm enough for a comfortable shower or bath, but might bother you if you like it really hot. For my part, I’d much rather have the great AC. The only substantial inconvenience I experienced was with Internet access. I signed up for the prepaid whole-trip service – a bargain at 15E per day including mini-bar beverages – but it required going to the main desk each day to get a printed code. I strongly recommend to go with the prepaid service as it will save a lot over the pay-as-you-go model, but the new code every day was a hassle. As for Internet speed, it was adequate but not great. It was good enough for email but you could expect problems with services such as Skype at peak times (evenings). The hotel rate provided breakfast, which was substantially better than I expected. It was a self-service “buffet” format with both quality and extent higher than my typical experience in Europe. The foods included a variety of pastries, cold cuts, cheeses, juice, fruit, cold cereals and muesli, coffee (either American style or espresso), and a couple of hot items (e.g., scrambled eggs and sausage). The room was large and pleasant but also somewhat busy. It made for a great start to the day but would not really serve as a “café” style leisurely breakfast. Other reviews have mentioned things like an odd shower curtain and dirtiness. I saw two rooms and both had glass showers, and my room and my colleagues’ were all spotlessly clean, so perhaps those reviewers were unlucky. As for service, I had only moderate demands (laundry, wake up calls, and the like) but those were all handled well (and in English). It is clearly not a Ritz or Four Seasons, but was good for its class. Overall, the hotel exceeded my expectations and was a relative bargain for the price: definitely not cheap, but with a room that was larger than expected, very clean and modern, quiet for sleeping, and a very nice breakfast option. If I return to Rome on business, I would be happy to stay there again. For a personal trip, I would also strongly consider it; I would weigh its quality and value against the slight inconvenience of its distance from good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate room, poor shower system”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCanuck
Reviews.Content: As other reviews, twin beds pushed together, we had the circular shower curtainwhich unless you were VERY VERY careful resulted in flooded bathroom floors. I f you get one of these rooms ask for a change immediately, not wortnthe hassles. Otherwise an adequate room.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better after reviews on trip advisor or were we unlucky???”
Reviews.Author: w_collins40
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in the evening with my partner for our two night stay. Went up to the room no 231 to find twin beds put together, we booked a queen size bed. Went into the bathroom to find a cracked toilet seat, and a shower curtain which was dirty with mold on the bottom, The bathroom was supposed to be a wet room , but the fall on the water went the wrong way and flooded the bathroom floor.My partner ended up on his knees mopping the floor with the towels. We phoned the reception and they said we were given the last room, nothing else available for the night. They said they would send up the maid to change the bed into a kingsize then the next day we could have a superior room. Next day after being out all day we arrived back to a superior room with a double sze bed and a shower which wouldn't drain and flooded the room. What a nightmare, we didn't want to change rooms again if one was available as it was eleven oclock. There were no gowns and no towels then for the morning shower. we were told to close the door stay in the bedroom and the maid would clean the bathroom, there was no door on the bedroom.The room 120 also had a tram which came past every few minuetes ans was noisy with the street outside full of tratorias, and people dining outside till late.When we pulled back the curtains in the morning we noticed the window pane was cracked. The breakfast could have been better, scambled eggs bacon and tiny cocktail sausages. Tinned fruit, and lots of cakes and pastries. I wouldn't recommend this hotel, they have a lot of maintenance work to do, looks nice in the photo's but doesn't work in practice. Not cheap for this kind of standard. £356 for two nights B/B.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location but Lower than Average Service”
Reviews.Author: althaus
Reviews.Content: With the hotel's location just a stone's throw away from the Termini Station, it is very convenient for metro access and passengers arriving via train. Walking to the hotel from the main entrance of Termini takes less than 3 minutes! The hotel is newly renovated and is very modern and clean. Having arrived at close to noon, we were disappointed that our room wasn't ready yet. The reception at the hotel also wasn't the warmest nor friendliest. Our room booked for 3 was of a decent size and was able to accommodate a full-sized sofa bed on top of a queen sized bed. Bathroom was a bit small, though it was nicely designed. I added EUR 30 for internet and complimentary minibar for the 2 nights I stayed and found it to be worthwhile if the hotel has such a promotion. The internet was fast and there was a good choice of non-alcoholic drinks in the minibar. No branded toiletries in the bathroom, but they were alright and comes in nicely designed bottles which could be re-used. Breakfast offered at the restaurant had a wider choice than the one at Venice, though was of lower quality. It was also crowded during breakfast as the hotel seems popular amongst tour groups. During our stay, a large section of the restaurant was occupied by a Japanese group. The concierge was able to provide reservations for tours within the city, though I don't recommend going with the tours they suggest as the tour felt too rushed. One complaint we had was that on the last night, the hotel's water supply was chlorinated, and thus it made it impossible to bathe comfortably. Not sure if it was a city-wide problem or not, though the hotel did not communicate anything to us. We got to know of it through a housekeeping lady which brought us mineral water, and only after using the water which we thought felt funny. For the price we paid at around EUR 200 for a night, the accommodation was decent and good value for money. Though I think the hotel could do more in the service department and communicating any special conditions that might exist in the hotel that could inconvenience guests.

Reviews.Title: “Read & heed all the bad customer service reviews if you are thinking about booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJ_5555
Reviews.Content: I wish I’d noted that so many of the previous reviews had given high ratings for the hotel location but really low for customer service. This was also my experience. To be fair the hotel has some good points – good location (if you want to be near Terminii) and excellent soundproofing. The breakfast was extensive, although the coffee was truly shocking for Italy. Where it is let down is the service and the infrastructure. No internet access for some of our stay, and no hot water which when you’ve been travelling all day and really need a shower is not great. And sounds like it happens quite often, which may explain the attitude of the staff – it’s not our fault and we aren’t going to do anything about it or apologise for the inconvenience. And at €250 a night this really isn’t acceptable. I guess with so many one-time visitors they don’t feel the need to be helpful as they know you aren’t going to return. Well my advice is stay away from this hotel until they get their customer service sorted. PS if you do decide to stay here despite the reviews, use the special offer on TripAdvisor for free internet access, otherwise it is around €25 per 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, yet no compromises.”
Reviews.Author: Dapogee
Reviews.Content: Quite simply, you would be hard pressed to find a better value. Modern, well run, on site parking (for a fee) great breakfast, and perfect location. We walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon stay - great location, value, rooms, breakfast, etc!”
Reviews.Author: Cristina2315
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Una Hotel Rome during the first week of September for our honeymoon. It was an easy hotel to find - being located only a block or so away from Termini train station. They say the area is dangerous being close to the station, but we only noticed that very late at night and only if you find yourself on a dark street (just stay on the lighted, busy tourist streets around there and you'll be fine). Oh yeah - there's a nice little grocery shop located directly across the street where you can buy snacks, water, beer (much cheaper than in restaurants), wine, etc. We were offered an upgrade for our honeymoon and took it, however, it was an Executive Room on the first floor (only a little bit bigger than a normal room) and, being light sleepers as we are, we could not even get a wink of sleep because a tram comes right next to the hotel - almost sounds like a jet engine warming up when it comes by every 5 min or so up until 2am every night. So after that first night's stay, we asked to be moved to a "quieter" location and they immediately moved us to a standard room on the 4th floor which was perfect for the remaining 4 nights of our stay. The hotel staff is wonderful, you feel very safe with the "big Italian" security guards standing at the front of the hotel night and day, the breakfast buffet is perfect - eggs, bacon, breads, danishes, cheese, cereal, juices- you name it. This hotel is brand new and you see it in the design right when you walk in, and the rooms are very modern and contemporary with a huge flat screen tv too. They also had 2 absolutely amazing recommendations for nice restaurants in the area - Ristorante Alessio & Nuova Stella. We loved our time in Rome and at the Una Hotel Roma, and hope that one day soon we can come back and stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent room, BUT TERRIBLE Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Karla24
Reviews.Content: The location is good,a block away from the Termini (to arrive and leave to the airport by bus), the room was more than ok, loved it, but unfortunately the front desk lady was super rude when I arrived after traveling for many hours... her attitude was far from helpful didn't even lend me a light adaptor to charge my phone (could not buy one either, t was 11 pm), I asked for a map she rudely answered she had non, no one helped (not even offered) with my luggage, and when I accidentaly "almost" got into the wrong elevator this man histerically yelled at me for doing so... I was appalled and did not feel welcome at all,plus I was traveling alone to Rome since I was going to meet my friends the next day... the next day staff at the restaurant showed more manners. I traveled to six other countries after Rome, and not once did I get such a rude welcome and lack of attention from hotel personnel, as I did in UNA Hotel, and to be honest it is a shame because the building is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: DePo79
Reviews.Content: All in all the hotel was a good value for money. It is new and is decorated with taste. Our bathroom was large and had shower. Some rooms in the hotel have bathtub. The breakfast was good as in all Una hotels. Personnel serving breakfast was clearly stressed and a bit grumpy. Location of the hotel is a matter of liking - if you are spending only some nights in Roma and is going to continue your trip by train or plane the location is convenient. The subway and buses are 5 minutes walking distance. The forum and other interesting places are 20 minutes walking along via Cavour. There are lots of touristic restaurants and fast food around, so you never go to bed hungry. We've not managed to find decent night clubs/bars around the hotel. Drawbacks: no free internet in the lobby, receptionists could be more welcoming and smiling. The area looks suspicious in the evenings due to vicinity of the Termini. Soundproofing could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in good location but service made me rate it average”
Reviews.Author: TheTec86
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in good location just one block from Termini station. Rooms are clean and very modern style. I liked the design of the rooms. Breakfast in itself was very good with a lot of choices. The bad is the service at this hotel. At arrival I was given a smoking room even if I had asked for a non smoking room like I had reserved it from Expedia. I was told that the room was the only one available to me. No apologies. The safe in the room was not working. After many requests to fix the safe and no response from the staff I gave up to ask for it. Breakfast Buffet was great but you had to ask for coffee which is ok if you received the coffee in a timely manner. The staff came with the coffee usually after I was finished with my breakfast. No free internet and its use is very expensive. Go to the internet cafe's around the corner. Calls to us via VOIP only 5 euro cents at these cafe's. I usually do not like to complain but for the price I paid I deserve a little bit better service. Therefore I will rate this Hotel only 3 star. There are cheaper choices with similar service.

Reviews.Title: “An actual true 4 star hotel in Rome for once”
Reviews.Author: Lazzzyboy
Reviews.Content: We booked in advance online and got a great deal with this hotel. I've stayed in many hotels in Rome that claim to be 4 star but usually they'd be lucky to even be a 3. This hotel is new and clean, it also is right next to the main train station and only a 15 minute walk to the Colosseum and other attractions. The breakfast was delicious. If i ever go back to Rome I will Definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: judyping2010
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Great location. 15 mins from Coleseum though bit uphill on way back which can be bit tough for older travellers. 2 min from Rome Termini, with option to take trains to Florence etc Staff very friendly and helpful with directions/advise etc. The hotel is very clean. Limited vegetarian option for dinner (we got 15% discount for restauarnt) No hesitation recommending this hotel, I wonder if it's quite new as some taxi drivers didn't know it. Hopefully it will retain the competitive price (€150 per night for 2 people incl breakfast) and friendly manner.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean rooms let down by poor service”
Reviews.Author: Live_t0_h0liday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in two sets (5 nights when we first arrived in Italy, then 1 night on the way home) and unlike some other reviewers found the location to be very good. Easy walking access to most sights and close to Termini for those who like to catch the metro. We found the rooms to be clean and modern. On the negatives, we found the staff at the reception to be unfriendly and unhelpful. They weren't very impressive when we asked some basic questions like where to go shopping, places to eat etc. When we left our first stay to book for our final night a month later, they booked it under a different name. Very unprofessional as we were checking out at the same time, so no idea how they got that wrong. Luckily when we came back to check in, I had the confirmation slip and my credit card receipt so we weren't stranded without a room. Breakfast which is included in the rate is average at best. Limited hot food and fruit. Lots of varieties of pastries although the quality is not very good. Good location, but I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NICE ROOM, TERRIBLE SERVICE AND OVERPRICED”
Reviews.Author: alacazam
Reviews.Content: Please read MLVReading's review below as I have to agree with almost everything he says. The service across the board was curt and unfriendly. For a high end hotel I have never in my life come across such poor service from front of house staff and I have stayed in a lot of hotels. The appearance of the hotel on the outside as well as the lobby and the room itself was very nice. The room was clean and modern but small (which is to be expected in Rome). It had all the mod cons you would expect in a higher end hotel. Wifi was ridiculously expensive. 6 euro for one hour or 10 euro for 2 hours. The service at breakfast was terrible. They don't have self serve coffee or tea so you have to ask for it. Every morning without fail we had to ask at least three times before we were served with coffee. Staff were curt and unfriendly. There are few hot food options and they were very average. Cold options were good, many pastries to choose from as well as cereal (but with UHT milk). There was no hotel service guide, so we were not sure exactly what facilities the hotel offered. I asked the hotel reception about this and they just told me they don't have a guide and I should ask them if theres something I am after specifically. The room had no iron, no tea or coffee making facilities. It had a reasonable view of the street, and was quiet but you could not open the windows at all. Compared to other hotels I have stayed at that are at the same level, this was the worst I have ever stayed at. Its no more than a 2-3 star hotel in 4/5star clothing.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore bad reviews of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alba1966
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of the reviews on trip advisor. It IS an excellent hotel situated as all the other reviews say minutes from the Termini. The hotel is clean, the staff are helpful - our Scottish accents were a wee bit too much for them at times :-) and the room was perfectly fine for the short time we spent in it. i would recommend this hotel to anyone in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent rooms & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hippychick40
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to Termini, Bus Station & Metro. 15 minutes walk to Colesseum. Great room with air conditioning which is essential in Rome in the summer. Great choice for breakfast. Would stay in hotel again and only wished that we had stayed in UNA Hotel in Milan on the next stop on our visit of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel in many ways”
Reviews.Author: MLVReading
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hotel Una after reading the (suspiciously) high number of positive reviews. Bad mistake! First of all, the hotel is located in a really AWFUL part of Rome, near an area notorious for prostitution and drug dealing. Having accepted that, given its close proximity to the railway station, we found that our room was very small and minimalist. OK, not a big deal as at least it was clean. The beds were typically Italian - in other words ROCK HARD! How anyone could sleep on these slabs of granite amazes me. I did not have a single night of decent sleep thanks to these terrible beds. At least the shower worked well. Breakfast was the usual Italian fare: little hot food other than some low quality scrambled eggs, undercooked mini-sausages and bits of streaky fried fat that resembled something like bacon. On the positive side there were many types of pastries for those who like to eat sweet things in the morning (I don't) and also bread, ham and cheese. The coffeee served was of good quality. One evening we decided to have supper at the hotel - it proved a disaster. The hotel provides a 15% discount for guests on the very expensive list prices, bringing them down to merely 'expensive'. The portions served were insultingly small; my 'half chicken' was more like two legs of quail! Also, the menu choice was extremely limited and accompaniments to the main courses a very strange selection indeed, marked by a total absence of potatoes. The waiter then served my wife's dessert from the set meal menu she had chosen and totally forgot to ask me if I wanted a sweet at all - very unprofessional behaviour. The hotel offers internet access, though at €10 for every 120 minutes it isn't exactly given away. TV choice in the room is awful if you are an English speaker - CNN is the only English language channel. Hotel staff varied a lot in quality - the people at reception were generally very helpful and polite, while the restaurant staff appeared uncaring and thoughtless. Overall, a most disappointing experience - I won't be using a Una hotel again the next time I go to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Uber sophisticated hotel with uber aloof staff”
Reviews.Author: Mattiasdad
Reviews.Content: otel wasn't hard to find (we'd rented a private limo) and for the price we'd paid (special rates for stays over 3 nights) this hotel is a steal. Location beside the bus, train & metro terminals were both a blessing (easy access to the city via bus, tram & metro) and a curse (lots of undesirables lurking around the perimeter and thus the need for tough looking security staff). Front desk staff are aloof and smiles do not come easy to them (despite my best efforts to establish a rapport... might be a function of the "big city" mentality). Rooms were well appointed and the bathrooms equally nice. We had a bit of a draining issue with the basin and it was promptly fixed the next day by housekeeping (bonus points for us not even needing to call it a request for repair). The shower doors are ill designed and the floors do tend to get a tad wet as a result. 35+ degrees outside and the air conditioning worked flawlessly (although we had to get an extra key to keep it powered on while we were out). The complimentary breakfast was one of the best I'd had (although didn't remember we had access to it until the last day when I overheard the front desk informing another guest of it... wished we'd been reminded of it when we'd checked in... my bad). And like other's have mentioned, wireless is pay as you go (€3 for 30 minutes minimum). I ended up bringing my iPad and getting a local micro SIM card from a shop in the terminal (do not use any of the stores around the hotel... they are a ripoff!). €8 for 3Gb @ 3G speeds for the whole month (I was lucky and they were having a special promotion).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffers77
Reviews.Content: Spacious and comfortable rooms. Very comfortable beds equals a great night's sleep. First visit to Rome but this Hotel's central location meant we were within walking distance of all the main tourist sites. If we go back to Rome we will have no hesitation in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: intrepidcbp
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for a 2 day break in Rome with my husband and 2 friends. I chose Hotel Una based on other reports on the Hotel and was not disappointed. The location is great, close to the station and metro and about 15 mins walk to the Collosseum. There is a good choice of restaurants in the vicinity if you are too tired to venture far from the hotel after a day of sight-seeing. The staff were very friendly and helpful, giving us a map and advise on how to get around and recommending good eating areas on arrival. The room is excellent and we were fortunate enough to be upgarded to a superior room and our friends to a suite. The shower was great, especially after a long hot day of walking the city. The bed was very comfortable and we had 2 great nights sleep, with no disturbance from traffic noise often encountered in large cities. Rome is beautiful and the main tourist attractions are easily covered in 2 days, but if you want to really explore, stay longer. If we ever return to Rome, which if our wish when throwing coins in the Trevi Fountain ensures we will, we will definitely stay at the Una Hotal.

Reviews.Title: “a very neat tidy hotel close to all amenities with friendly helpful staff. A pleasure to stay there we extended our stay”
Reviews.Author: sue0439
Reviews.Content: we were very happy with our choice of hotel it was ideally located. The rooms were spacious and very clean and the breakfast was superb. Would recommend it to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieSharon
Reviews.Content: Just around the corner from the main station and surrounded by economical trattorias, this is a well located property. It is only quite new and the rooms are modern and clean the bathrooms are large and well appointed though the bedroom is very small, the queen bed took up most of the room, but it was great and excellent value for money. The public areas are very nice, the restaurant good and the staff very helpful and friendly. I will use this hotel again for sure

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL,A MUST IF YOU GOT TO ROME!!!”
Reviews.Author: smiffy10810
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to rome,a mini break straight after our wedding to put us on till our actual honeymoon in jan,an wow what a break.We arrived at the hotel late at night after a full day of travelling,we were great at the desk,an was very happy to recieve a free upgrade to a suite,after been shown to our room,we were just blown away,it was gorgeous,a brilliant size with everything we could want an more.we had breakfast there every morning an it was fantastic,had drinks in the bar on a night (during the happy hour) an got lots of great nibbles with them (which were not your standard peanuts an crisps i`m happy to say) we ate out every night just because we wanted to experiance the local restaurants.I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL IF YOU HAVE NEVER BEEN TO ROME BEFORE,its in an ideal place,2 min walk to the termini,20 min walk to the colosseum,had an amazing time an this hotel was the icing on the cake,really made our holiday going back after a long day to such a fantastic,well thought out hotel.I`m 29 an my husband is 45 an we would recommend this hotel to anyone, any age.

Reviews.Title: “picked this hotel for location”
Reviews.Author: Thomas011
Reviews.Content: I was so glad we picked this hotel, you are 3min away from the trams - trains- underground and the bus to the air port which costs 4EUR The hotel was very modern clean and comfortable, the only down side no tea making facilaty in the room. Staff were excellent,from the reception to the breakfast Reception staff were always helpfull with advice on how to get to differant part of Rome be it by bus - tram or metro I would be disapointed if we could not stay at this hotel the next time in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: amprychidny
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were in Rome mid-July & stayed at UNA for 2 nights. It exceeded our expectations. The rooms & hotel were lovely, super-clean & the breakfast was AMAZING! We would stay here again in a heart-beat & any of the UNA hotels. This hotel is in a great location also. Close to the main train station & close to hop on/off tours.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in all ways”
Reviews.Author: Abrah
Reviews.Content: Great attention to detail, comfortable and thoughtfully laid out rooms, large well-appointed bathroom, fantastic breakfast, easy location - you just can't find fault with this hotel. The staff are so well-trained that it's a relief to check in here after some of the other places I stayed in Italy. If I ever go back to Rome, this is the only place I'd consider staying in. I can be quite harsh about hotels (see some of my other reviews!) but this place is fantastic! (And take advantage of the "free internet and minibar" deal - it's well worth it!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel near train station”
Reviews.Author: magoo2b
Reviews.Content: The hotel was 2 short blocks from the main train station in Rome. We were only there for a day, and we took the train from the airport and then the next day to Civitavecchia. The hotel was new and modern. The front desk crew were all very helpful with directions and recommendations. Our room was small, but well appointed and the shower was fabulous after a long plane ride! The breakfast was also wonderful, with fresh fruits and pastries and a terrific cheese selection. Internet wasn't free, but the hourly rate was quite low. The hotel was the perfect choice for a traveler who wants to be near the train station. We booked our room through the hotel web site and got a very fair rate of 125 Euro at the heart of the summer season.

Reviews.Title: “Very contemporary & clean & near Termini Station. You could walk to the Collessum or the Spanish Steps in 20 minutes.”
Reviews.Author: Donna97070
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in May, 2010. The bedroom and bathroom were very clean. We had wonderful hot breakfasts (included in price of room) each morning. We ate a delicious dinner there one evening too. Mostly we wanted to explore so we ate at one of several restaurants nearby for lunch and/or dinner. We were very close to Termini station so we took the subway to the Vatican because we had to be there for an early morning tour but all sightseeing was within walking distance if you had the time. The Coliseum and the Spanish Steps were each about a 20 minute walk. We found the staff very helpful with directions too. We used the Hop on Hop off bus for two days but once we knew our way around the city we found it quicker to walk or take a regular bus. The bus and subway were very inexpensive to ride.

Reviews.Title: “Callous disregard for advance reservations”
Reviews.Author: chicobubba65
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation at the UNA Hotel Roma several weeks in advance to our trip to Italy and received a written guaranteed confirmation. After a lengthy and tiring journey from Los Angeles, we arrived at the UNA Hotel at around 8:30pm and was coldly told that the hotel was 'sold out'. I showed the desk clerk a copy of my written confirmation, but he simply repeated that the hotel was sold out!!! . I travel to Europe often,and I will never, ever consider staying at a UNA hotel again. A lot of my friends and work associates also travel to Italy quite a bit, and I let them all know of the risk in booking a room with this Hotel chain. I think they also will steer clear of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: berneezy
Reviews.Content: - Downstairs bathroom is super clean, with modern design - We stayed in Superior Queen. It is definitely small. But clean. Modern. - Bed was comfortable - Bathroom was modern and clean - Shower doesn't totally close. - Temperature is controlled from the front desk. - When getting off Termini, from the Airport, you just cross the street and it is a short block away - Hotel's name is sideways, hard to find at first - Little away from the city center, but the convenience of the tram makes up for it, all metros stop here, so you can go anywhere quick - Breakfast is great, hot and cold breakfast. If not included in your hotel, I don't think it's worth it, though.

Reviews.Title: “A great "first stop" on our trip”
Reviews.Author: stout5710
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel that we stayed in on our trip to Italy on our Honeymoon back in May. When we arrived (with our extremely limited Italian speaking ability) we were cautious and wary of how "ugly Americans" would be treated. The front desk at UNA was extremely nice and helpful! It was definitely a great start to our wonderful trip. The guy at the front desk even joked about me looking like Edward Norton and wrote that on our key holder (and referred to me as that throughout the stay). We expected the room to be extremely small and sparsely furnished. When we opened the door we were definitely surprised. The room was large and very clean and classically modern in decor. It was very nice. The bathroom was large and comfortable and very clean. There was a TV but we didn't really watch it. The breakfast was the best "included" breakfast that we had in Italy. It was a buffet style breakfast that was included with the room that had juice, meats, pastries, bread, fruit and yogurt. They even had "American Cafe" which was just like American Coffee. We didn't eat there for dinner so I cannot comment on that aspect of it but I would venture to guess that it was very good. We meant to eat there on our last night but got sidetracked and didn't make it back until too late. The location isn't too bad as it is right by the termini. During our first stroll out of the hotel we walked right by the non descript San Pietro in Vincoli (where Moses is located) on accident. We were so pleased with the hotel itself that if we are in a city with another UNA hotel, there is a good chance that is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, great location, wonderful free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pathologist_traveler
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed staying at this beautiful, sleek hotel located one block from the train station in Rome. The rooms are quiet, contemporary and luxurious. The breakfast was delicious. We will try other locations of this chain. It was completely nonsmoking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wonderful rooms, modern”
Reviews.Author: Polichka
Reviews.Content: I have spent 4 nights in May with my boyfriend in this wonderful hotel. we've booked online and also ordered a special package (for 10 euros you could get your mini-bar restocking every day and unlimited wi-fi in room). that was definitely an option to go for. the hotel itself was very clean, modern and had plenty of dayligth. since we arrived in the morning we couldn't check in and just left our stuff in hotel's closet and hesded directly to Castello Romano. after we came back the checkin tok us about 10 minutes. The room itself was not big, but had a very nice modern design, huge bathroom, flat screen TV, AC, free safe-box, mini-fridge (incl. water, beer, juice, cola and snacks). The bed was biiiiiig and comfortable. Towels were changed every day if you leave them on the floor and bed sheets were changed once. although we were leaving our stuff (shoes, t-hirts etc.) in a complete mess every time, the maiden was putting everything back in order. the only minus is the location, it's 20 minutes walk from Spanish steps. But on the other hand you are very close to Termini train station and if you travel from/to the airport with Leonardo Express it's very convinient, since you don't have to pay for a taxi, which is quite expensive in Rome. As for the food, we stayed on BB basis and liked it. Every morning you were met by a hostess which took you to the table you could sit at. once they tried to push us a table in the middle of a walking area, but after we refused they offered another good one. food choice was really big, but the same stuff every day. if you go there, make sure you try chocolate croissant, it's LOADED with chocolate! when we were leaving our hotel, they charged us for internet and mini-bar, although we paid for it while boking special offer. it's worth saying that every nigth we had to get code for wi-fi and explain that it was booked before as an offer from the hotel. so in the end it spoiled an overall impression. But I would definitely recommend this hotel if you don't mind staying very centrally.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Quady83
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome for 3 nights in May and stayed at the Una Roma. We had initially booked another hotel but changed last minute to the Una Roma based on the reviews here. The hotel is beautiful and modern. Room was small but clean and with everything you need (travelling from the uk we did not have an adapter though and the hotel did not have anyeither- take one with you). We were slightly concerned about the location however found that the hotel was actually in a good location. Near to the Termini and we walked each day to various sights. On foot it is 10 mins to the Colosseum, 20 mins to Piazza Navona and we even walked to the Vatican City which took about 40 mins (great way to see the city). If you are going to Rome I would recommend the Una Roma - it is a much nicer, more modern hotel than most in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in our entire tour of Italy!”
Reviews.Author: Devsarkar
Reviews.Content: Great location next to Termini station. Allowed to check-in an hour earlier. Room are tastefully done, Bathroom is spotless and new. Breakfast is lavish, best we've had in Italy and oveall complete value for money. The only blemish is the hop-on hop-off bus (Ciao Rome) service they are tied up with. These guys have to be the worst HOHO service in Rome. We'd see at least 2-3 buses of other HOHOs go by before ours arrived. We were even stood up once with another couple when the last scheduled bus did not arrive. We waited for an hour and finally paid 20 euros for a taxi back to our hotel. If it weren't for this, I'd give the hotel a 5star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jmryglod
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend this hotel. It has the perfect location, just one block from the main train station. It has also been beautifully renovated on the inside. The free breakfast was also very good, with lots of options.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms, comfortable beds and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TOMMY6723
Reviews.Content: I stayed there one night and I wish I could have stayed a week. I went on a cruise and when I returned, I stayed at a more central Rome hotel. There was no comparison to the Una and I paid $80 a night more at the other hotel. I wish I had booked the Una for the return stay. There was 6 of us staying in 3 rooms and we all agreed that the Una was a the nicer of the two. Anyone planning a trip to Rome would be well served to look at the Una as a great place to spend your vacation dollars. The staff was very friendly and the service was excellent. I work for a major airline and fly to Europe all the time and this hotel is an amazing hotel for the price. . If and when I go back to Rome, I will stay at the Una. Plus, dont miss their breakfast that is included in the price of the room. It is a full breakfast and it is delicious.. Dont overlook this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: westi77
Reviews.Content: After extensive seaching to find the right hotel for our first visit to rome we found UNA Hotel, reasonably priced for Rome and just what we loved, modern, clean, comfortable and very helpful. We could not have asked for a better hotel!!! Located just around the corner from the train station where most of the buses drop off and pick up from the airport, and gives you easy access to the metro for all your site seeing! (the metro is soooo easy to use to get around rome quickly!), not to mention is centrally located for all of the major tourist attractions, most things being in walking distance of around 20 mins! If its your first visit to rome and you're worried about finding the right place the definately book UNA hotel, brilliant nights sleep, great breakfast that will keep you going all day and fantastic and helpful service. Made our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: tres-passerr
Reviews.Content: Located 10 mins by walk from Roma Termini, the hotel is a great pick. Thanks to tripadvisor's reviews, we booked the hotel for 3 nights, as part of our Honeymoon trip. We were very impressed with the Hotel's facilities. We were upgraded to a superior room upon check-in, and it was an excellent room-very spacious and classy. The bathroom was huge and very nicely done-up. The bed was very comfortable and the air-con was perfect. The continental breakfast was sumptuous. Most of the front office staff were friendly; the hotel is centrally located, with most of the Historical locations within a 20 minute walking distance. The only glitch, per se, was that there was some repair work on the railway lines being carried out at night. We could hear the noise till late at night. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bella bella bargain”
Reviews.Author: thescribbler2010
Reviews.Content: As a regular to TripAdvisor I take the reviews seriously. So it's great to be able to fully recommend the Una. Forget all the nonsense about "dodgy area". It's ideally placed for the station (and arrival from airports), right beside the Metro lines, close to restaurants, and 20 minutes walk to the Colloseum for starters. We managed to spend a whole day walking from the Vatican, through the city, to the hotel. In fact, there wasn't once we didn't walk back to the hotel, and we even had a buggy and a baby. On arrival we were upgraded to an executive room. For the price we paid, this was great and we're so pleased to have discovered the Una and want to recommend to anyone not wanting an old-fashioned, basic, over-priced hotel. This is modern, and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: malinas
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the photos found on the internet and I was not deceived, it looks just as beautiful in real life. It is newly renovated with a modern interior and gorgeous bathrooms.Everything in the room was new, and the cleanliness is impecable. The location is a decent/good one for rome, just across Termini station, it takes about 15-20 minutes by foot to get to Piaza d'Espagna, and about 3 minutes to get to the subway station. As a minus point I would say the breakfast could be better and maybe a spa/pool to better justify the price (the hotel doesn't come cheap compared to other 4 star hotels in Rome ).

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel in a 2 Star location”
Reviews.Author: gogens
Reviews.Content: Beautifully modern furnished hotel. Some ants in bathroom but otherwise very clean and spacious. Breakfast was so so but great staff. Front desk and doorman staff were ok but not great. Location is good if using train but otherwise not great location and not all that safe a feeling at night given general overall neighbourhood. If you like walking, it is ok to get around to all major sites other than Vatican. Need to add more english speaking tv channels to reflect customers they have and are trying to attract. Not including internet in rate lowers the overall perception of what Star rating this hotel is trying to portray considering it is 2010 and 'lessor' hotels do it readily. Overall a gem in a seedy neighbourhood that will get better with time.

Reviews.Title: “UNA to Avoid”
Reviews.Author: jnjreeves
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the UNA by a travel agent who claimed she couldn't find another good hotel with four rooms. What a mistake. For starters, the employees were so cold and indifferent to our needs, we thought they were automotons. The hotel is antiseptically techy and yet has no voice mail, wake up calls that don't work and charges if you blink. One block away were many hotels at a third of the price that would have been a far better selection. We love the warm, friendly people of Rome but the UNA is the antithesis of that. You can do a lot better for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorwichHomer
Reviews.Content: good hotel, staff efficient and helpful. Had superior room, clean and bright, but looked out onto square with other room windows (no view). Paid £125 with travelzoo offer, so prices rising, but still worth the money in an expensive city. English breakfast not great, cold egg bacon and plates, microwave would have helped (just a suggestion) but lots of other options to start the day. Tv's everywhere, lobby, corridors, room, and plenty of football ! when in Rome !!

Reviews.Title: “Quality 4* hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SuperDonkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in the Una hotel, which is conveniently located near to the main train station in Rome. The hotel has only been opened for less than a year which means that the place is spotless, very clean. The room we stayed in was a superior room which was bigger than the usual small rooms on offer in hotels in Rome. The bed was massive and very comfortable. The ensuite bathroom had a big bath and a very good overhead shower, no problem for a 6' 4" giant. Breakfast was a buffet style where you helped yourself to the food. Almost anything you wanted was here, the only thing you couldn't get was a traditional english fry-up. The waiters at breakfast were excellent, very attentative, we ordered tea, coffee & hot chocolate (what pigs!) all in the same sitting. Nothing was too much trouble, The bar & restaurant are very expensive, even for Rome, and the choices didn't seem that extensive or appealing. There is a lot of road works going on around the hotel, so it can be quite noisy. Also, where our room was located (425) there is a lively restaurant across the road which can be a bit nosiy at night, but not too bad. All in all I would highly recommend Una hotel, especially if you can get a good deal on their rather high normal room rates,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, value for money”
Reviews.Author: B_bbs10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through travelzoo on a special offer and free upgrade to deluxe superior room. I paid around 70 Euros a night which was extremely good. The hotel is excellently located on the road next to the main train station so easy for Airport trips on the Leonardo Express. The main reception area of the hotel definitely has the wow factor, clean, marble effect. Check in was very quick and easy and even gave you a free guide book. We had a great room although the view wasn’t great (looking out across a courtyard in to another wing of the hotel) but we were not in the room much so didn’t bother us at all. The bathroom is very spacious and clean with complementary slippers (although no bath robe). The shower head is huge so great for long showers to prepare you for a day of sight-seeing! The rooms are cleaned daily and to a high standard… even folded my clothes that I had left draped over a chair! Breakfast was included in our room price (even better!) but I’m not sure it would be worth paying extra for. There wasn’t any cereal on offer, but they did have the typical European breakfast of cold meat, cheese, cakes etc. They did offer a cooked breakfast but it was limited to the English taste. However, adequate for us! The only small thing i would say is that the concierge is not very helpful (he may have been new!) but he didn’t know the Vatican opening times (FYI- it is only open on Saturday mornings, closes at 1pm, shut on Sunday...) and when we asked if he could recommend any restaurants, he said the restaurant at the hotel is very nice. That may be so, but when in Rome, you want to experience other restaurants! We took the metro to the Spanish Steps and made our way back to the hotel visiting all the other sites such as the Trevelyan Fountains, the Pantheon etc and managed to get back to the hotel without taking any public transport so even though the hotel is not near any of these big attractions, they are walkable if you don’t mind walking long distances! The Coliseum is definitely within waking distance. Get there early as the queues are huge. We had a Roma Pass (you can buy them in the main train station next to the hotel) which allows free entry to 2 attractions (excluding the Vatican) and then queue jump as well as free transport for 3 days (excluding the Leonardo Express). Definitely worth getting if only for the queue jump! A great little restaurant is called Giggetto Al Portico D’Ottavia (http://www.giggetto.it/english/home.htm) which is traditional Roman food and reasonably priced. It is very popular with the locals so I would suggest booking in advance or going early. Our waiter was very good at suggesting dishes and wine to go with it. We had picked a more expensive wine and he suggested a cheaper one (!) which complimented the food exactly. I think he even gave us a free dessert (we were there a while as enjoyed the atmosphere so much!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - bad sleep”
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation I finally settled on this new hotel near Termini Rail station in Central Rome. The hotel is nicely decorated throughout with Italian marble floors in the lobby and wooden floors in the bedrooms. Beds were very comfortable and although we had a nice balcony that came with booking superior accommodation ,due to the rain we were not able to use it and consequently the room felt quite small. Bathroom is spacious with a glass walled walk in shower - peculiarily there is no mirror in the bedroom. Nice flat screen TV also with about 40 channels but only one in English BBC World. While I liked the rooms I did not sleep very well as the AC switched off in the middle of the night making it very uncomfortable - seemily this is a requirement in Rome at this time of the year overnight ! Breakfast was very busy self service style each morning and the choice was adequate. Overall I liked the hotel and the staff for Rome were genearlly helpful although the area that it is situated in is rather seedy but compensated for by the concentration of the transportation network in this area making it easy to get anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel next to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveller999
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was very pleased with this hotel. We stayed in a few hotels in this area, and this one was the best given the price. Location: Just a block or so away from Termini station. No cab needed. Less than a few minutes walk away. We were able to walk to every other point of interest (Colosseum10 mins away, Trevi Fountain was 15 mins away, etc.) except for Vatican City, which was a short metro ride away. We did take cabs to certain restaurants for dinner just because we didn't feel as comfortable walking around at night. If you don't want to venture out at night, plenty of decent restaurant options nearby (Alessio and La Matriciana are a couple) Room: We got a classic double room. King sized bed, VERY nice bathroom with the usual amenities. Water pressure great.. towels were big. Beds were not the most plush I've slept in, but so much better than a lot of other European hotel beds you'll encounter. Nice bedding and pillows. Mattress on the firm side. Wifi in the room is available, but at a charge. I believe 22 euro a day. Breakfast: Probably the best I had in the few hotels we stayed at. Really nice dining area, friendly staff and great pastries + the usual fare: eggs, meats, cheeses, breads, yogurt, fruit, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for Termini”
Reviews.Author: Mark241
Reviews.Content: Having been working in Rome for a while, my colleagues and I have stayed at several hotels near Termini - and the Una is by far the best. Modern, stylish rooms, good high pressure showers, flat-screen TV, but most imortantly of all - really comfortable beds and quiet rooms. Many hotels that we've stayed at in the area suffer massively from noise from the streets - but the rooms at the Una are really well soundproofed. We usually pay €125 / night B&B, and this compares really well to other hotels in the area. 20 mins walk to Colosseo or the Trevi Fountain, and you are literally 2 minutes from Termini for trains (including the Fiumicino service) and the metro. Highly recommended for both business travellers and people wanting a base for their Rome trip.

Reviews.Title: “A good new hotel if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: Dave094
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Una Roma in February and thought it was a good hotel. We had an executive room on the Travelzoo offer and this gave us tea and coffee making facilities (standard hotel kettle and sachets, but no milk). The rooms were good, clean and new. We did have to change rooms after we lost the water supply, but this was done with the minimum of fuss. Hotel is near Termini - good for getting around, but a more run down area than right in the centre. Negatives were the mini bar and bar prices, which even by four star hotel standards were extortianate. Overall, a good hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and quiet new hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: rome920
Reviews.Content: Hotel is brand new, location is great esspecially if you are arriving into the Termini. The staff is helpful and friendly (a nice surprise in Italy). Exit the main exit from the Termini and go left for 1 block hotel is on the left. We walked all over I recommend ordering a map of Rome from Streetwise and walking from the hotel to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Colosseum. Public transportation is close and easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine893
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2009 shortly after it opened and when everything still had that new smell! The staff were super friendly, the rooms were amazing and modern and the location was super - you can walk everywhere from here!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, New and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: GlyderFawr
Reviews.Content: Agree with the positive points from the VintageCouple below. We were on the same deal a week later. We had a huge shower but no bath which I wasn't expecting. The sleep quality only gets a 3 because although the bed was great, workmen started digging the road up under the window at 6:45 each morning. This might be finished in a week, a month, I don't know. But I'd check first. Its located on the edge of a rough area, but don't let that put you off. I would stay there again if we went back and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: vintagecouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7th to 12th March in a Superior room on a travel zoo special offer. The hotel is very conveniently placed near the Termini. The rooms are very modern with excellent beds and bathrooms. The buffet breakfast included in the deal was very good with plenty of choice. The waiting staff very helpful and service very efficient. Unfortunately the weather was not very good but the room was very warm, computerised heating system which we never seemed to work out. Only drawback was no hospitality tray. We ate locally as the weather was not conducive for walking far. On the Via Principe Amedo we enjoyed meals at Elletra /Aquila Nera./ Tudini Gabriele and Tomoko. Penty of choice and fresh ingredients. The staff were very helpful and spoke good english.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful design hotel conviniently located”
Reviews.Author: Nitus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in February having booked their inexpensive opening rate. We arrived early (10am), but could not get into our room yet. Anyhow the front desk staff was very friendly and welcoming (An attitude you will not find very often in Rome being a non-Italian speaking tourist.), handed us a map and a travel guide. When we returned later at 2pm, we finally could get into our room. The room was beautifully designed and very bright (due to its white painted walls). But beware that the design is quite modern and might not meet your personal taste, if you're more into baroque Italian style. Nevertheless the room was quite big, had a comfy bed, a nice flat-screen TV (with BBC World being the only non-Italian channel, we could find), effective blinds, temperature control units located on the wall and on both bedside tables. Although it was winter and the outside temperature was around 10-15 degrees Celsius, we did not manage to get the room temperature below 23 degrees. A big plus on the other hand is the quietness of the room. Being only a few hundred meters away from Romes Termini central train station, we expected some noise to be heard in our room, but nothing! The bathroom was also quite big and was equipped not only with a toilet, shower and sink, but also a bidet. The shower itself featured a detachable shower head as well as a rainshower head mounted to the ceiling. A full range of toiletries had been provided. The huge towels were soft. Being a techie I appreciated the RFID key cards, which you did not have to insert in the room door's lock, but just had to briefly hold in front of the card reader next to it. Also the LED lighting installed in the wardrobe's clothing rail, which would light up when being opened, was a nice gimmick. Breakfast was a lot better than the usual Italian breakfast fare. Anyhow being a German-Thai couple, who likes to travel a lot and used to European-American-Asian breakfast buffets, we were left a bit disappointed. The broad selection of sweet cakes and pastries was nice, but the scrambled eggs and the too greasy bacon and Italian sausages were cold. So we also tried the toast and bread along with the meat cold cuts and cheeses, which were ok. Compared to all the other hotels we had stayed in Italy before this is by far the best! Great location, very clean and great modern design, spacious well equipped rooms and a decent breakfast. The minor flaws really are minor and it's Italy after all! A great hotel for a beautiful trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with a bathroom you could live in”
Reviews.Author: rockysgirl38
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Very nice room, immaculately clean, slippers, toiletries, safe in the wardrobe, lighted wardrobe and according to my travelling companion, a bathroom he could live in! Rain shower, bidet, huge sink. My only complaint about the room was that we ordered a twin room, which it was but the beds were next to each other, no gap. That was ok for us but if we were not such good friends, could have been very uncomfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful, accommodating in every way. Breakfast very good, full continental, large selection, we generally had two pots of coffee and I am sure you could have more. Excellent location! Walk to the termini within minutes where all the public transport services run from. Stayed here for my 40th and I would definitely recommend this hotel without reservation and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ShellWEssex
Reviews.Content: The hotel was gorgeous very clean and comfortable....would defiantly stay there again !!!! Great value for money also and the breakfast was great as I have a wheat and gluten intolorence which they catered very well for..........

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Cost-conscious”
Reviews.Author: jjm523
Reviews.Content: In short, a nice, clean hotel in a mediocre location if you want to see Rome. It's better suited for business travelers and cost-conscious travelers as it's only a 3 minute walk from the Termini train station. - Staff is very good - the business computers didn't have Acrobat and the receptionsit allowed me to use her computer to print my boarding pass. Pretty exceptional. - Bed was incredibly comfortable and the Superior double room was a good size - Breakfast buffet gets a 10 - Loved the "rain" shower - Bar is blah and has no personality. In all, a decent choice if you can get a deal. We paid €87 per night, but it's probably worth about €110'ish per night. My only gripe is the hotel lacks any character whatsoever and feels completely soulless. I wasn't crazy about the area either. there's little to see around there.

Reviews.Title: “Numero Una!!”
Reviews.Author: SHartland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Una for 3 nights via a Travelzoo offer. It was a great value for money offer, however this is not the only reason that I would recommend this hotel. The location is literally a two minute walk from the Termini station and so no lugging your suitcase for miles. We found that we could still walk to the old centre of Rome in 15-20 minutes. The hotel has had a very smart re furb with great facilites ( the only thing lacking for us Brits is tea/coffee in the room!) The buffet breakfast offers plenty of choice and the staff are very helpful. We had a very memorable stay at the Una.

Reviews.Title: “take the executive room!”
Reviews.Author: Chutney101
Reviews.Content: OMG, what a room. The bed is 2 meters wide and you sleep like a baby in it. The bathroom is wonderfull with a nice bathtub and a rainshower. You can control the lights with a remote control near the bed. Breakfast is fantastic with a wide variety of choice. The staff is very accomodating and friendly. The whole hotel has an atmosphere of sheer luxury. It's very nearby Termini so you can take the subway or bus.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and sympathic Hotel (French language)”
Reviews.Author: Stichatwork
Reviews.Content: Modern style with nice room. Big bed very confortable. The people speak french which help to ask question on what to visit in the cities.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MichelleW15
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is very clean and convenient located near the train station. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Facilities are modern and great. Very spacial. Will definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location - Fantastic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dappie
Reviews.Content: Haven endured a very long and tiring train ride from Paris, Una Roma was a sweet relief. Recentkly furnished to a very great taste, it is close to the Termini and within walking distance from the main attractions. The internet service is not worth paying for, it kept going off while the minutes keep counting and though the hotel was aware of the problem refused to give a refund or extend the minutes. Apart from the glitch, will be glad to return to stay here - if the price isnt increased as currently being speculated. By European standards, the rooms are so very roomy

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: rachieb77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 6 - 10 December, having booked a special deal advertised on Travelzoo. We decided to upgrade to an executive room for an extra 20 euros per night as a treat. On arrival, our bags were grabbed by a porter despite us wanting to take them to our room ourselves, resulting in us having to give a 5 euro tip due to us not having any change (the hotel reception wouldn't change a note for us). When we were shown the room, it was clearly a standard double room, not the executive kingsize with sofa that we had booked and paid extra for. The porter called reception for us, who were insistent we were in an executive room. After a few minutes of "discussion", we were moved to another room with kingsize bed and a sofa. However, we were still not convinced we were in an executive room as there were no tea & coffee making facilities (an extra in the executive rooms). We tried to call reception but our phone didn't work, which meant another trip down to the foyer...not the best start to our stay. We were provided with a kettle and some tea & coffee but no milk, be warned that if you like milk with your hot drinks it costs 3 euros for a small jug from the hotel bar (this appeared on our final bill). The room was very cold for the first couple of nights, the air con was set to come on automatically (it kept kicking in, even when we switched it off). There was no form of heating in the room so we asked for extra blankets. The settings on our control panel seemed to change after the second day with the maximum temperature increased, not sure if other guests had complained but it was a lot more comfortable once the room was warm. The hot water was a bit hit and miss in the mornings, on the first morning we had no hot water for about 5 minutes (nothing came out of the tap!) then it suddenly kicked in. One thing that the hotel doesn't advertise is that there are major roadworks going on around the hotel at the moment, it was very noisy from early in the mornings with builders digging up the road and laying pipework. Not exactly relaxing! The area around the hotel (Termini) also leaves a lot to be desired, I'd recommend you stay closer to the centre if possible both in terms of safety and convenience. Overall, we found the hotel really disappointing and we wouldn't stay here again or recommend it. We were made to feel we were being a pain for complaining about our room and asking for the extras we had paid for. If you pay for an executive room, make sure you get one! Also, as an aside, make sure you check the bill while you eat out in Rome - like the hotel, it seems a number of places are out to take advantage of unwary tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Staff! Definitely Recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Didem76
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Rome on the 1st of December 2009. We stayed 4 nights at Una Hotel Roma. It is a new, very nice hotel, very nicely decorated. It is very close to Termini Station and walking distance to many historical sites. Colosseo is 10-15 minutes walk. People working at the reception helped us a lot, they were very friendly. Breakfast was good, the bed was comfortable. If you want to stay right in the heart of attractions, you need to stay at an older or more expensive hotel but if you don't mind walking a little, then Una Hotel is the right place to stay. If you have limited days, take a sightseeing tour of Rome. If you have time, definitely go to Pompeii to see the archeological site, visit Mount Vesuvius and Positano is a must to see......

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSTHol
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights. Arrival was perfect, good explantion of facilities and shown to room - brilliant! Room was immaculate and the bed simply huge. Bathroom was clean and highly functional. Breakfast was typically Italian - good and wholesome buffet with staff bringing drinks. The location of this hotel is ideal for a central stay and close to the main railway station and buses to the airport. All in all, oustanding.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Mick73
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel situated about 2 minutes walk from termini Station. I understand this Hotel has been recently re-opened following refurbishment. It has been carried out to a very high standard. From the moment you enter the reception area you immediately feel the quality. Our room was very spacious, immaculately clean and tastefully decorated with a large flat panel wall mounted TV directly opposite the bed. The large en-suite included a top of the range double shower with piping hot water which could almost drown somebody on full power - fantastic. I would not like to guess the price of a better room in Rome centre. The staff in the hotel were extremely helpful and couldn't do enough for us. The bar area is also very relaxing and had a huge flat screen TV. Breakfast was typical Italian with Fruit Juices, Cereals, Breads, Croissants, Fresh Fruit, Cakes and even Scrambled Eggs, Sausages and Bacon if you were desperate. We also left the car in the Garage which cost 30 Euro / Night. Not sure how that compares with other charges in the centre of Rome but worth noting. At least it was easy and secure. Hope to go back one day
